But I will have to say , yes it's possible, it is even better!!!! We tried 4 different things tonight. For an appetizer we had the shrimp and calamari cocktail. How many ways can I say delicious, it literally melts in your mouth ,with a little kick of habanero. Next was the Ensanada crab cakes. They are stuffed with crab and shrimp and come with a chili cream sauce to sop up with the crab cakes. My husband had the San Luis Potosi Pork Chop with creamy mushroom hominy. There is just not enough good yummy words to say about this meal. To top it off we had the  newest dessert, peach bunuelos . That , with the always awesome margaritas and good fellowship , was the perfect evening.  Thanks again Canonita family for a super great dining experience.

I'm typically not a fan of Mexican fare on the Strip because the outrageous prices tend to lead to disappointment and regret. But, Canonita proved to be a pleasant surprise with it's quality ingredients and above average execution. Located  in the Grand Canal area of the Venetian with much of the narrow restaurant overlooking the man made waterways and sitting under the faux sky, the ambiance can be surprisingly relaxing.

Their drink list is full of custom cocktails and margaritas. The pineapple infusion margarita ($11) was excellent with tropical flavors and hints of vanilla. For those that can't decide, they've got a margarita flight ($15) with a classic,  jalapeño, and pineapple version.

Plenty of popular dishes can be found on the menu like flautas ($12), three per order, all crispy and tightly rolled with ample amount of ground beef inside topped with an avocado-tomatillo sauce, lettuce and quest fresco. The entrees were quite good. The wild mushroom enchiladas ($21), covered in a poblano cream sauce, were an excellent vegetarian option. The Santa Rosa pork barbacoa ($21) was a hefty portion of for-tender meat topped with a slightly acidic sauce, surrounded by fluffy and buttery cilantro rice and accompanied by tortillas to make your own tacos.
Stopped by the other day for happy hour. Enjoyed some great carne asada and tres leches. Our waitress Brooke was super awesome! I'll be requesting her again! Really enjoyed her recommendation!!

Thumbs up to the taco truck. Every time i pass by am always tempted to stop. So far i tried the Carne asada and the chicken tacos, those are to die for. The tortilla Chips are crispy and have a fresh flavor, lets not forget about the Guacamole which was amazing. Definitely one of the best tacos in the Valley.  I got to bring some or all of my coworkers one of this days.

Easily my favorite meal out of the entire Las Vegas trip. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is the service. It took nearly ten minutes to seat us when over half the restaurant was empty. Our server also made sure to put the 'wait' into waiter. 
The food though... the food was freaking fantastic and so were the sangria de rojo and regular sangrias. Barbacoa, fajitas, burritos - all outstanding. The sangria de rojo is an awesome mix of a red sangria and a margarita. Heavenly!
I like to sit near the canal and watch the gondolas. 
You could say the place is pricey, but I had plenty of terrible meals for the same price as here. Nothing is cheap here. 
Don't miss this place.

I was close to giving 4 stars but just couldn't do it due to the food flavors. Atmosphere was great as it sits on the canal with great views. Service was good and friendly. The biggest draw back was the flavors. We got the 5 taco sampler and tried mushroom, chicken, pork and beef. Chicken and beef were both pretty good with fresh ingredients. The mushroom tasted like they were almost pickled and the pork had decent flavor but was so dry it was almost not edible. The chips are very thick and overwhelmed the salsa that had almost zero flavor. Overall good atmosphere, just lacked great food.

Food was amazing! Super delicious, wonderfully prices and great porky on sizes. A little upset the meal didn't come with chips and salsa but other than that I love this place. 
The biggest issues that I had was with the hostess. Upon entering the restaurant I was told rudely that "UM YEAH WE DON'T ALLOW OUTSIDE DRINKS IN HERE SO THROW THAT AWAY NOW". If she had simply informed me politely that they didn't allow outside drinks that would have been fine but she pretty much went out of her way to make a scene. When I finished my drink and was seated with my party the ENTIRE night she kept motioning and pointing to me, telling the wait staff to keep and eye on me and kept shorting me dirty looks and shaking her head. A shame that the hostess really ruined a great meal for me and my party...just remember: it's not what you say but how you say it!

Cherri is THE BEST SERVER! So knowledgeable, personable and attentive. Austin W, how do 
Know these employees last names? Why so mean? Suspicious!!!!

I seriously don't get why this restaurant doesn't have more stars. This is easily one of the best Mexican food I've ever had. This place is soooo good! 

The ambience was perfect and decor was lovely as expected since it's in the Venetian. I thought it was gonna be just your average Mexican restaurant but it was so much more than that! 

I had the cheese enchiladas with cilantro rice and I can't even begin to say how delicious it was! It was too perfect for words. 

I've had cilantro rice at a few other restaurants after that but it's nothing compared to this place! The portions are big enough to where you can have leftovers to savor for a late night snack! 

A little pricy, I'll admit but well worth it! To this day I'm still raving about my amazing dining experience at this place! I'm definitely coming back the next time in Vegas!

I didn't know what to expect from this place but HOLY MOLY their food is bomb. Salsa was fire, chips were light, crunchy and perfectly salted, entrees were superb, and dessert was the icing to the cake. Oh yeah, the cocktail was quite effective. A little more pricey than I would have thought, but well worth every penny. Service was also amazeballs. Ask to sit in Brian's section!

We had lunch here, and the experience was great. We sat right by the canal, so we saw all of the gondolas go by. The chicken burrito I had was amazing, and the drinks were all tasty. One of my favorite dining places on the strip!

Canonita is a great place for breakfast!!  Pass up the typical buffets and hotel restaurants and stop by.  Service was excellent, atmosphere is charming and food is delicious.  On my visit, I tried the Mexican Pancakes served with potatoes and bacon.  The portions were generous and flavorful-they hit the spot!  Food was so good, we went back again the next day.  Tried the Steak and Eggs-it was a home run!  Will definitely be back to try out the dinner.

Tips: Breakfast is served until 11:30. Very convenient if staying at The Venetian.

Although the waitstaff was excellent and environment was nice; just overlooking the gondola rides the food was quite sad. 

They use the phrase soul food however there is definitely no soul in this food. The restaurants food didn't have any flavor at all; it was incredible plain.  I have tasted more flavor from the seasoning packets at the grocery store. I recommend you go somewhere else and save your money. The only thing delicious here are the chips.

This place has been here for 19 years.  It's right by the Venetian lake where you can be serenaded by the gondoliers and tourists floating by you on gondolas.  The renovated decor here is quite nice, and colorful, as though it were a street corner in Mexico.  (A nice touch is the bright robin's egg blue Citroen truck parked on one side of the restaurant where tacos are sold--smart!)

The crab cakes ARE quite good (as others have said), but "muy picante" (very spicy).  It would have been nice for the server to let us know that.  Thankfully, I enjoy spicy, and it was delicious.  But my husband did not fare as well, and could only take a bite.  He also ordered a steak dish with beans that had really spicy onion and jalapeños on it that made his eyes immediately water and his hands reach out for water (which was almost gone).  Needless to say, he did not enjoy his meal.  And at $36, it was a waste.  Again, this is something the server should have given a heads-up about!  I took some of his onions/jalapeños and placed them in my pozole soup, and MAN ALIVE, it was HOT! I had to immediately take them out, but the contact with the soup, made it irredeemably spicy thereafter, even for me.  (Though I did nearly finish it, anyway).  I think the server should have given a heads up, as I said. I even ASKED about the spiciness level, and he said not to worry.  The menu should probably give a better heads-up, too.  Not everyone is a spicy food person; some of us are gringos, remember! This is a tourist place, after all.   And it took a long time to get re-fills on drinks, and our server kept forgetting our corn tortillas, etc.  I was trying to get him to get me the enchiladas to try, but he didn't catch on. Maybe he was given too many tables?  It's a busy location. 

Aside from the crab cakes, the Queso fundido is a safe bet, too. (Cheesy, rich, and not spicy). The pork pozole had a nice, mild flavor.  I would avoid the chocolate dessert.  (Though I am a chocolate fanatic!)  It was way too dense.  But the tres leches cake was better.

Overall, the food was tasty (though I suspect loaded with salt and/or MSG, or artificial sugar or something--we were really quite bloated that night--first time in a long while, despite eating out a LOT), but the service was lacking.  

Aside from not providing good information about the spice level of the food (despite asking), and not getting drinks filled, the server failed to give us the 10% discount that the manager suggested that we get for being locals.  Even though we asked, and he said he would, he didn't do it.  I didn't notice until I reviewed the bill walking away from the restaurant.  And we called about it, and were told that they would take it off the bill and get back to us...but no one got back to us.  Bummer.

The service could have been better. It was a very slow day that we visited and the wait service was even slower. It look 20 minutes to make a margarita. Seemed like an eternity before a waiter came to take our drink order of water. The ambiance was dim lit in the center of the restaurant. The patio area is very romantic because it allows you to watch people being strolled down the river in a gondola. Overall I was not impressed by the customer service it lacked luster. On the bright side the food was more than delicious it was magnificent.
Good services! Decent Mexican food~ beautiful river view watching boats come and go...great experience!!!

Fun location right on the canals to enjoy the gondolas singing by....

Excellent margaritas, chips and salsa and guacamole. Other dishes we tried were very good. Excellent service....one diner had trouble with spice, and they nicely had the dish redone cutting back on the heat.

Nathan was awesome! Super attentive and made us laugh. Drinks stayed full, and all his recommendations were spot on! I ordered the mushroom enchiladas which were delicious, and my friend and the tres tacos that he really enjoyed, especially the cilantro rice.  For dessert, we ordered the coffee flan, and the lemon cheesecake both were yummy. But the star of the dining experience was forsure Nathan!
Alex (alejandro) is an excellent bartander! Great customer service, very nice, drinks were delicious. Sure made our first visit to the restaurant amazing.

I had to revisit this restaurant again with three people who had never eaten there....and was NOT disappointed!

We had a great time - I ordered the same dish which was still amazing! 

This time around we had a couple of bottles of Sangria which we fell in love with. 

This is my favorite casual restaurant in all of Vegas to date!

Before anything, they have bottomless mimosa for breakfast!!! 

Ok, this restaurant is right by the canal, so it's a lovely place to have breakfast, lunch, dinner, tea while listening to the amazing gondola performers.

We had a simple breakfast, omelette, churros, empanada, and I forgot the rest.
The churros had caramel in the middle and it came with goat milk caramel sauce. It was so awesome! 
Their coffee is good too!

Good casual mexican grub..... awesome queso fundito!! But as others have said... entrees were just ok. Not bad, but nothing that will bring me back again with all the other Vegas dining options. They do have a great "Patio" - next to the indoor grand canal. So that was fun. 
Service was awesome... I even forgot my brand new sweater....they had it tucked away safe for me!

Love everything about the restaurant! Amazing tasting food, hard working staff in the kitchen, & out on the floor as well! The manager Ricalynn was so friendly & accommodating to where we wanted to sit! Gave us an amazing spot, & throughout the night checked on numerous tables including us to see how we were doing & if we were enjoying our entrees. Loved the amazing consideration she showed to everyone in the restaurant & the help she provided for her entire team. Danielle served us & was very knowledgeable about the menu! Loved her amazing service on such a busy night, & loved all the recommendations she had for us! Overjoyed to come here & can't wait to come back again!
Not great, not bad. Let's call it a little better than average.

located in the back of the grand canal in venetian.  a little quieter than the main piazza de san marco area.  from the patio seating, you can watch gondolas making u's at the end of the grand canal and gondoliers singing serenade. we had a yummy pork chop and shrimp enchilada, but other menu looked as enticing.

This place was weird, but still tasty. You're eating unauthentic Mexican burritos by a Venetian canal in Vegas for $18??? But hey, it's Vegas. Pros: Food is actually not terrible, location, portion size Cons: price, authenticity.

Food: I had the chicken burrito ($18) and it was surprisingly good if I forgot that I was eating Mexican food. The burrito was smothered in what tasted like bbq sauce (what??) and filled with shredded chicken, beans, fajita veggies, cheese, etc. The cilantro rice and black beans on the side were actually better than the burrito. 

Atmosphere: Probably why people come. They have a patio on the Venetian "canal" so you can watch gondoliers go by while you eat. 

Value: Vegas is expensive, but $18 for a burrito??? At least this has extra large portions. Would be easy to split in two and save some for later. 

Service: Very amenable!

We hosted 25 friends for my wife's birthday party at Canonita Taqueria over the Labor Day weekend.  Everyone from the busboys to the waiters to Michael, the manager did everything right and made it a memorable event.  The food was amazing and the margaritas were deceptively potent.  Everyone went away happy (and buzzed).  We couldn't have been more pleased.

Hungry and craving Mexican food in the Venetian? This is a pretty good place to go. The portions are big and the restaurant itself is nice. It is right next to the canal so you can wave at the gondolas going by. 

I agree with the other guy. The food was solid.  We ordered the carne asada tacos which came with 3 tacos and a side of rice and beans. It was good, but we weren't raving over it. THE POSOLE THOUGH. It was my first time having Posole (I was surprised it was green) and it was really tasty. My friend knows her food and she loved it as well. We kept wanting to go back for more Posole, but didn't have the chance to.

My wife and I met up with some friends who were in town for a convention. We decided on Canonita because we saw it while riding the gondolas. The food, service, and ambience were all great! We sat almost near the water, with a great view. Our waitress, Brooke was very kind and attentive. She recommended the jalapeño margarita and mussels to start. Glad we went with both, dipping the bread in the chorizo sauce was delicious. I had the barbacoa and my wife had the salmon... great choices once again. We will definitely be back, thanks Brooke!

With all of the steak house's, Italian restaurants and seafood place the Las Vegas strip throws at you, why the hell did I pick a Mexican restaurant to have my one dinner in this town while I'm here on a "Pit Stop" trip? 

Simple!

I've been on the road a month and I missed this cuisine terribly. Living in L.A. Mexican food is a staple for me and SoCal (other than Mexico) has the best!

So here I am at Canonita salivating over their comprehensive menu wanting to order everything. I settle for the beef Mexico City style enchiladas with rice and beans. Good call on my part, this combo plate was delicious. Washing it all down with a Pacifico beer, I was a happy camper.

The service and atmosphere at Canonita are terrific. 

I finished my dinner, hopped in a taxi, saw Hamiton (the musical) and put this evening down as one of my better ones this year.

Thought this place was pretty good. Really enjoyed the jalapeño margarita. Friend had pineapple margarita and it wasn't so good. Chips and salsa cost extra. Salsa was good. Guacamole was excellent. We had the chicken and pork street tacos which were tasty. The beans and rice that came with street tacos were pretty bland. Probably better to just order the 5 street tacos (doesn't come with rice and beans) and split them with someone, instead of two plates of 3 tacos each with rice and beans. Atmosphere is great b/c when sitting "outside" the gondolas are going by and drivers are singing, so that's fun.

MEH 
CHIPS AND SALSA SHOULD BE FREE

pricey meal so go during happy hour 

They don't have Tajín (chile powder rim for drinks) that's a big no no for me especially at an "authentic Mexico City food restaurant"

The tuna ceviche looks more like cat food - it's a good amount but needed more lime

Pretty ok my favorite part was the view of the gondolas 

I'd go for drinks and appetizers only during happy hour

Mexican food in an Italian themed resort. Sure, why not!

Came here at a recommendation of a coworker and sure glad I took his suggestion. The place was mellow for a Friday lunch. Grab a spot "outdoors" so you can pretend you're in Venice as the gondolas float on by.

We ordered the beef tacos and chicken fajitas entrees. Each comes with that addicting cilantro rice in that bright green hue. mmm...I could just eat that rice nonstop, and not because I'm Asian! The beans where meh. But, but...their beef and chicken were marinated just with the right spices which made the entrees so delish, both of us were borderline licking out plates. 

Oh, and you can't get Mexican food w/o a Margarita. Hot damn..those were divine...

Given the wrong food.  Never told that our Brunch order was put in AFTER Brunch ended. So the wait person just substituted other food for our order.  She never came out to explain and let us decide for ourselves what we wanted.   

Poor service and the food we were served was bland.
Had a great meal here, and managed to get a seat next to canal, which made it even better. Service was great, particularly with my wife's lactose allergy.

Best breakfast I have ever had in Vegas. Sometimes spur of the moment ideas are your destiny. I research and plan almost every minute of my vacation. Throw in a 21 year old and you have to be able to adjust. As she slept in, our breakfast buffet plans went out the window..like Doug's mattress. 

So, down the strip we went in search of a place for a late breakfast. She had never been in the Venetian and as she stared wide eyed at the tables next to the indoor canal, she said, "At some point I want to eat here." I took a quick look at the menu & they serve breakfast until 11:30am.

We were seated immediately, right on the water. It was so lovely to watch the gondolas pass throughout the meal. This restaurant is in a prime location, right where the boats stop for a brief serenade. We heard numerous versions, from the traditional to the light hearted for the kids. 

Now for the food. I am still thinking about my plate here. I have searched high & wide for an excellent Huevos Rancheros and Canonita truly delivered. The rice was light, pillowy, fresh and full of that deep stock flavor that a good Mexican rice deserves. The beans were also fresh, seasoned perfectly, and had a hearty texture. Each side of the plate featured a sauce, red to the right and green to the left. The red sauce was slightly sweet and complimented everything on the plate. The green sauce had just the right kick to make your tastebuds sing. Both were complimented with a perfectly cooked, over easy egg and luscious jack cheese. 

Service was wonderful and the prices were great, especially considering the ambiance. The whole experience was truly 5 star.

This was the closest I've ever come to eating actual rope. 

The chicken was so dry I asked for box so I could use it to anchor my boat. After two thunderstorms, the boat and chicken-based boat device are both in tact.

Additionally, all of the other purported "meat" used to fill taco shells were equally as unsavory.  However, none of the other fillings had anywhere near the tensile strength as the chicken-rope. 

Thanks taqueria canonita! 

PS - if you do have a need for cheap rope, don't plan on going here with others. You'll  end up paying for all of their chicken-ropes, as well. They do not split checks.

4.4 stars.

Almost forgot to write a review about this place.  We were browsing the Strip and ended up in the Venetian during their Winter in Venice showcase.  We were hungry but didn't want to spoil our dinner that was in a few hours.  So we all ordered the Mexican Chopped Salad of grilled chicken, roasted veggies, smoked panela cheese in a beautiful Sherry-cumin vinaigrette (4.5 stars).  Along with margaritas (4.5) and great chips, salsa and guacamole (4.5), we were satisfied.  Service was prompt and pleasant (4 stars).  A rather interesting setting along the "Venetian canals" under a simulated wintry-blue sky.  Mexican food in "Venice".  There's a first for everything.

Tally:
Mexican Chopped Salad:  4.5 stars
Margaritas:  4.5 stars
Chips/Salsa:  4.5 stars
Service:  4 stars
4.5+4.5+4.5+4= 17.5/4= 4.4 stars.
Overpriced.... Not very flavorful ... Expensive drinks not a lot of alcohol... Iffy service... Only redeeming factor was location... Go somewhere else!

Pros: great views of canal & blackberry mojitos

Cons: terrible & poor quality food. We had the flight of tacos & instead of putting different toppings (e.g. Sliced cabbage, lettuce, etc), they got lazy & put diced onions across ALL of the tacos.  I've eaten here previously & loved the tacos. Now, I don't even want to return. The chopped salad was also not fresh & we were convinced the chicken was going to give us food poisoning. Meat just shouldn't smell or taste like it was made last week.

Lastly, the server put the wrong order of tacos on our table & had to swap it out while we were mid bite. Overall, just a horrible experience. We ended up going to Chipotle around the corner & happily munched on food that wasn't going to make us sick!  I did NOT come to Vegas to eat at Chipotle, but that just shows how bad this place was.

Food's good, not great but good. Standout dish is the Barbacoa...seriously worth trying. My brother was served his shrimp burrito with shrimp tails still on the little guys, which made for a crunchy(not to mention inconvenient) experience. Cost is reasonable......for Vegas.

The cocktails were very good, the classic margarita and the michelada were ordered several times at our table with no complaints. NOTE: they do a happy hour until 7pm on most nights, but only at the bar!! The happy hour price is nearly 50% off on the margaritas, if your looking to save a buck. If your not eating dinner, they serve drinks in TO-GO cups even at happy hour prices.....very nice!

The best thing about this place is the location inside the Venetian, if you get a table on the "patio"(which means its not the bar area, hence not included in happy hour) you can sit right next to the water for the Gondola rides and listen to them sing(and watch the couples awkwardly stare at each other.... whilst taking their romantic trip in a circle..... through a hotel made to look like Venice, Italy) . It makes for a bit of a romantic dinner if your into that sort of thing, or at the very least some awesome people watching(im a fan). 

BOTTOM LINE: have a cocktail before seven, share an entree or the guaco and chips, sit back/relax and have a gander(or a laugh) over the lovely Gondoliers and their customers.

I was really looking forward to eating here but was pretty disappointed with what we had. I think this is just not my flavor style. 
The salsa is good (tastes a lot like my homemade salsa). 
Their chicken tortilla soup has wayyyyy too much cumin for me - I think it's cumin, at any rate, it is too overpowering. Takes away from the other flavors. 
The chile relleno had very strong conflicting flavors which made it unenjoyable to consume.
That is all I could try there, won't be back.

I was terribly dissatisfied by the pitcher of margarita that we ordered. It was myself my sister and my husband and we got a pitcher to share. Basically we got margarita mix and a lime wedge. They were too sour to enjoy. I would not come here for margarita unless it's happy hour. The food was like warm even though we waited almost 20 mins. I'd look elsewhere for Mexican in Vegas. The stars are for the chips and guacamole and salsa.

Absolutely one of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever visited. This place serves very creative and eclectic style Mexican food. Most dishes aren't what people would traditionally imagine. One of my favorite dishes is the wild mushroom enchiladas. They are super tender and come covered with a light green colored sauce. Very mellow flavors. They have a vegetarian torta with a thick slice of grilled tofu, and typically I'll only eat tofu if it's in miso soup. One of my absolute favorites is the pezcado veracruz. It's the 'catch of the day' in a marisco (red) sauce with rice. Imagine a fish stew, with a large cut of fish in the middle. The Vaquero beef rib is also excellent. It's a well prepared short rib in mildly spicy mashed potatoes. This restaurant is the ONLY restaurant in The Venetian that is located directly on the canal. Whenever we went, we always were seated directly next to the canal. The wait staff is always super friendly. Although the hostesses have often been unfriendly and will take forever to acknowledge your presence. Their drinks are pretty good. I recommend the sangria by the bottle. It's fairly inexpensive and very good. Not a bad way to pass an hour or so, sitting with your sangria at the canal. I think a lot of people are expecting a different style of food here. It's more of a gourmet style, with interesting interpretations. Don't expect a big sloppy wet burrito. For the amount and quality of food, I consider this place to be cheap. Entrees are around the $20 mark and they charge for chips and salsa. But the portions are generous (not gigantic) and the food and atmosphere are second to none. You would be hard pressed to find a better location than this, in Vegas. I highly recommend for a late breakfast/early lunch, when they open around 11a. It's also nice to eat at a place when I don't have to get dressed  up, seriously I am on vacation, don't make me wear something nice.

I had heard this was a good place to get Mexican food on The Strip, but I had no idea how delicious it would be. Our group tried a little bit of everything -- starting with crispy tortilla chips accompanied by fresh guacamole that let the avocado shine. The jalapeño margaritas and sangria helped get the party turned up, too. Our server, Juan Carlos, was delighted to help with recommendations; in addition, he is very good at hospitality and made us feel welcome instantly. I couldn't make up my mind when it was time to order an entree, so I asked Juan Carlos what he would pick. He suggested the Santa Rosa Barbacoa that features "guajillo chile rubbed pork served in a banana leaf, chipotle barbecue sauce, cilantro rice, black beans, and housemade corn tortillas." The kitchen roasts the pork in that banana leaf for five hours, so the meat is tender and can be pulled apart easily. I layered it inside the tortillas with the rice, beans, and sauce. What a treat! My two friends ordered the taco sampler and chicken enchiladas. They were equally impressed by their dishes. The location of the restaurant on one of the Venetian's "canals" adds to the delightful atmosphere, and your chances of hearing a singing gondolier are very good. I will definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas!

I would've loved to try the food here since this seemed like the only Mexican restaurant inside the Venetian, but their drinks were great. I came here at about midnight, and it was the only bar that was open around Tao. After getting shafted for $13 drink, I managed to save half the price by buying my drinks here. 

I talked the bar tender into making my vodka cran strong, and he went nuts with that vodka bottle. He got me stumbling out of that place and ready to party at Tao. Most important of all, the drinks were only $7 instead of $13. What a difference a walk down the hotel makes...

The food was good at first. 
Unfortunately I became violently ill after eating the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas. I was the only one in my group to eat this and I was the only one to get sick. Food Poisoning sick for a solid 3 days. First time in Vegas and spent the whole time in bed and in the bathroom. I will never go back. Be careful of the wild mushroom enchiladas.
Pleasant sitting and breakfast by the canal. Great apple-guava empanadas and rancheros. I would definitely go there again

kind of random for a mexican restaurant to be at the venetian...its definitely unexpected but a very nice surprise. i love that its right on the canal because you get to people watch and listen to the people singing on those boat rides. we were seated right away, our server was nice- he forgot to bring out water though, food was good, a bit more on the pricey side but expected. i ordered the pork tenderloin- very juicy and seasoned well. my friend ordered the ahi tuna- it was tasty but a bit on the salty side, she couldn't even finish it. we ordered the lobster and calamari cocktail and some chips and salsa for appetizers...both were really yummy. a pitcher of the pineapple infuzion margaritas were also ordered...they were really good. it provided a nice buzz as we left to go watch mystere. =P good experience over all. i would definitely come back...ooh and they have happy hour!

Been here twice already and I think I have found the best Mexican place to eat in Vegas. The tacos and horchata are so good and tres leches is also so tasty. So recommend this restaurant if your in the hunt for some yummy Mexican food.

We were staying at the Venetian and this restaurant had a coupon for 2 for 1 margaritas so we gave it a try. We started with the chips, salsa and guacamole which was very good. 2 of us shared the carne asada and eating too many chips and it was plenty. Our waiter was very good! We'll be back.

I really don't like Las Vegas. There . . . I said it. I had to get that statement out before I typed another word.

I am just not a Las Vegas kind-of-guy. The lights, the constant bombardment of second-hand smoke, the noise - I just don't like it.

I do, however, make a couple of trips a year to LV for business. This past trip my team and I worked out of the Venitian and had a very full schedule. As such, we had no time to get "off the beaten track" to find good-eats in Vegas.

The one meal we had that is worthy of a post is the Taqueria Canonita. The food is not great - but very good. The staff are wonderful. These was a wonderful person who helped us find our way around the menu. We had a working lunch and the server was so gracious in allowing us to linger and talk.

If you are ever "stranded" on the Las Vegas strip - this is a place that will "tick the box" of the food experience . . . and not set you back too much cash.

I ate at the Canonita for dinner with some friends in January 2016, and was not very impressed.

The restaurant is located in the Venetian Resort. The service was good. The decor/ambiance was pleasant.

I ordered the Chicken Caesar Salad for $15. The chicken was flavorless and chewy. I ate about a quarter of the chicken. I informed the waiter that the chicken was not very appetizing. I expected him to either offer another dish or to remove the item from my bill. He did neither.

I also had a Cadillac margarita for $12.50, which I thought was very good. My second drink I asked for the happy hour margarita for $5. I laughed when I got it, it's half the price, because it's literally half the size. Despite it's "short" comings, I thought that it was also very good.

In defense of the restaurant, all of my friends said they really enjoyed their meal and would come back. Maybe I just lucked out with my entree selection.

If you like expensive Mexican food, give it a try.
Cythnia was the best server!!!! We had an excellent experience. Food was amazing! Margaritas were great! Definitely a place to return to!

If you visit Vegas, you should definitely try this restaurant in Venetian Hotel. You get river side view with music in background. The ambience is nice and cosy. We tried the chips with guacamole & omelette with veggies with fresh juices in their breakfast menu. Everything was super nice and the service was great.

We really like to eat here when in Vegas.  The roasted salsa is very good and we've always had good meals here.  If you're lucky, you can maybe get a seat by the canal and watch them float by while you're eating.  I thought it was very reasonable compared to what other vegas places charge.
I had the best dish ever here and the best service. Juan Carlos was amazing and thanks to his recommendation I fully enjoyed the short ribs. I will absolutely be coming back here.
Margs were really sweet, guac and chips are decent, fish tacos have minimal fish... just v mediocre in general

The view is gorgeous- white sangria is delicious, warm chips and salsa were soo good. Does it get much better?
I went yesterday for my birthday, our server was excellent and brought me a free shot to celebrate. I left completely stuffed! The chicken fajitas were incredible! I definitely had a food baby when I put on my dress to go out that night...
This is a decent Mexican restaurant with great staff and a relaxed environment. We had some wonderful beef enchiladas and a nice dining exerience.

Canonita calls itself the mexican soul food cafe and they didn't disappoint. Had the chicken quesadilla with mushrooms. So much flavor and the chips and salsa were on point. Service was excellent as well. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a dinner or lunch spot at the Venetian.

Aside from the fact that our server totally forgot about us, I sort of loved this place. The happy hour specials are pretty good. I highly suggest the taco sampler and margaritas. YUM!

The ceviche was so fresh and clean tasting.

Went on a Thursday night with a reservation on OpenTable for 7. Got right in and the table was waiting for our table of 4. Liked the ambiance and atmosphere of the restaurant even though we were more to the inside. Chips were great as was my margarita. I ordered the Wild Mushroom Enchiladas, which had great flavor, but was a little more spicy than I expected (not a big spicy guy though). I think everyone in the group enjoyed their meal, but I docked a point for the service being on the slower side.

Two of us had lunch here with a menu selected by the chef.

Here's a list of items served the two of us.

Chips with rustic salsa and spicy chile salsa and guacamole
Roasted mussels and shrimp skillet.
Jalapeño queso fundido with tortillas.
Appetizer trio sampler--tuna ceviche tostada, posole verde, and chorizo gordito.
Patzcuaro duck relleno.
Toluca portobello mushroom.
Wild mushroom enchildas.
Santa Rosa pork barbacoa.
Shrimp and mussels Moqueca.
Carne asada.
Trio of desserts--coffee flan, tres leches cake, warm chocolate brownie.

My dining mate was brought a trio of margaritas to sample in the beginning and later we each were brought a trio of aqua fresca drinks--horchata, prickly pear cactus with lemonade, and watermelon.

I have rarely had a meal when I left without having some comment about something being able to be done better or spiced more or something along those lines. Everything I tasted yesterday was perfectly executed and beautifully plated. Some standouts were the posole verde. Prepared differently than I've ever seen, there was hominy, diced pork, green chile, tomatillos, Mexican oregano, shredded cabbage, and shredded red radish. What a great take on a classic soup! Another was the shrimp and mussel moquec--a Brazilian dish done here with a Mexican flair. The coconut aji amarillo sauce, looking like a curry but tasting nothing like it, gave the shrimp, rice, and mussels a great flavor. Last, the Patzcuaro duck relleno, a Michoacán dish, was superb! The duck confit was excellent. The dish is normally made with smaller poblano chiles, but Chef Willey made two larger ancho chile versions yesterday.

Service throughout lunch was top notch. The ingredients of every dish were explained and we were alerted when we were being served something that was spicy but there was nothing that would raise any spice alarms for me. The green salsa made with several chiles including habanero was spicy hot and I liked it.

Executive chef Willey came by several times to check on us, answer questions, and explain how some of the dishes came about. The General Manager, Annaliza McKinney, also came by to check up on us.

Two hours after being seated I left, very full and very satisfied. Every dish was really well done and I was pleased to have had the chance to try Cañonita--a restaurant that I've walked by many times and always wanted to try but somehow never did.

I've eaten here a few times. The food is very good and the atmosphere is cool. You get to watch touristas go by in gondolas while you eat and drink.

The guac is delicious and I reccomend the carnitas and carne asada.

The pina colada served in a coconut is ok, too, its called coca pina and just seems to taste better in a coconut.

Unlike most Mexican places, they do charge for chips and salsa, But being Vegas, I was surprised they did not charge for the water!

Stopped in for tacos and a margarita.  Tacos were good, my preference was the taco de pescado which was a firm white fish that held up well to the plancha with cilantro on a corn tortilla.

The margarita menu was quite extensive ranging in cost from $15 to $37.

I opted for the $15 version which was with Patron silver.  The mix used was a bottled variety which I did not really enjoy.

Great service, Alejandro (our waiter) was amazing. Truly made it a wonderful experience, not to mention having a beautiful view of the Venetian Gondolas. The food was also delicious. Highly recommended this restaurant.

Lunch today with Stephanie as my server.  She was attentive, made good recommendations on the menu and some "local" insider tips. Food arrived very quickly. It was delicious!  I had the carnitas with chipotle BBQ.  Beans & cilantro rice also very good.  Sangria margarita was also very good.  

I wish I could go back. Trapped in off strip resort for three day conference. I know I'll starve!

Oh and the location?  Charming!  Gondolier's serenaded throughout the meal.

Happy hour 3-6 pm and you get a $5 margarita!  Nice ambiance with a view of the canal. Friendly service and okay food. We ordered some empanadas and although they didn't pack a lot of flavor kids enjoyed them and presentation was nice.  I've been here before and its a nice place to stop in for some quick drinks and apps when at the Venetian Hotel and Casino.

I had an average experience at Canonita. The food did not surpass my expectations, unfortunately. My group ordered the queso, which was bland and so was the tortilla soup and tacos. 

It was nothing impressive, but the pricing I thought was overpriced. The tacos were dry and the tortilla soup was average.

The decor is beautiful and the atmosphere is decent here. I really like the margaritas.

Ate there today and the food was really good! I had the wild mushroom enchilada which was super tasty! Chips and salsa was also really good! Waitress was super nice and always made sure we had drinks refilled! I would just stay away from the margaritas since they are way overpriced for the size you get! Besides the tiny margarita we got, everything else was great!
Nice place to eat. Seated us quickly, even without a reservation.  Our waiter, Pablo, took good care of us.
The service is great, the food amazing, the place is really well located at the Venetian, this is the best place to eat Mexican food, the staff is the best, thanks for a great experience.

Cute restaurant inside the Venetian.  It's right along the canal so you hear the gondoliers sing their heart out. The staff are friendly and attentive which I really like. The margaritas were a little strong but I didn't mind that. I didn't have their chips and salsa, but straight up ordered my entrée which was a Moqueca with shrimps, mussels, calamari, peas, carrots, corn, white rice and coconut aji amarillo sauce. The sauce was not overpowering, you can taste all the ingredients.  It was an amazing meal!

I'm only giving this 3 stars because I unfortunately didn't try the food but it looked delicious! 

Nice view of the Canal shops in the Venetian. They had Happy Hour each night with really good deals on Margaritas. Interesting unique flavors. Staff was nice and I'd definitely suggest it for drinks!

This was a great atmosphere to be in, especially after a long day of traveling. I'm usually really picky with my mexican food but this place was great! I had these Carne Asada strips that were so tender and they came with some sweet corn tamales that were to die for! I can't wait to go back! Especially for those tamales!

my friends and i stopped by after being recommended to go there and right away we realized the service was horrible. multiple tables were seated after us and they received not only their food but checks before us. in between our dishes the waitress took over 35 minutes and once we ordered came back to tell us 30 mins later that a certain dish was not available. i have 2 friends that are vegetarians and they were not allowed to swap out for other meals. the pepsi we ordered came out flat without carbonation. they also said that the dishes on their menu can change from time to time. I WOULD DEF. TELL YOU NOT TO GO, ESPECIALLY NOT WITH A GROUP. the full meal took close to 2 hrs and we were the first table seated when they opened. horrible!!!!!!!!
Nice location but Service was very poor. Ordered chilaquiles but food looked like some of it was missing.

Decent restaurant. Las Vegas expensive.
I'm giving it 4 stars with demerits for the entrees. 
The guacamole and queso fundido were excellent.
Service was spot-on.
Great drink list.

Why can't I find a restaurant in Las Vegas with amazing entrees?
Dined here a couple times for a casual lunch and dinner,  service was great and tacos were good. If you're looking for a casual place with good service I would recommend.

Reliable place in the Venetian.   The chips and guacamole are nice starters.  The mussels and shrimp are my favorite starters.  The kids serving are quite sizable.   

The fajitas are nice.  Prefer the chicken over the steak as the steak can get dry.  The five street tacos add a nice variety.  

Overall I like this place as a reliable spot to eat if you don't plan ahead.  We have been coming here for over a decade and the kid doesn't mind it as well.  She likes the singing gondolas that pass by.

Absolutely delicious food! I had a chicken quesadilla and my husband had the tres tacos-chicken, beef and fish. The sangria margarita was delicious as well. We also ordered the chips and salsa for an extra $3. The chips were warm and fresh and the salsa was awesome. Our waitress was super nice and we loved having a seat by the canal. Can't wait to come here again when we visit Vegas again!
So stopped in for a rest, appetizer and a beverage.   Sitting on the side watching the gondolas pass by.   Really special.    Service slow / poor but ok.   Chips and salsa were good.   Great location

We actually ate here twice during our short stay in Vegas.  The second night were we going to eat elsewhere, but the crowd looked big so we moved along.  We decided to eat here again after hearing that the wait would be 30 minutes.  (It was after 9:30PM on Friday night so we figured that would the norm at other places.)  We had our table in less than 5 minutes.   The food was amazing.  Quick and good service.  Great sangria --- a bottle provide 6 full glasses.   I had the shrimp enchiladas both times.       Will definitely go back the next time I am in Vegas.  

Oh, I forgot, they have cilantro rice -- very good.

looking at all the reviews, either we were in vegas on the wrong weekend or this place is just not that good. we went with our wedding party to eat here, it was about 9 of us. The place is sooo pretty. Drinks were sooooo good. But the food was terrible. i had the Pollo con Mole Poblano, i sent it back, it was waaay over cooked, it was soooo dry, the rice was ok but i couldnt eat the chicken at all. zero flavor, i didnt even bother ordering anything else, my fiance had the Shrimp Burrito, it was soooo good, we just shared his meal. My best friend had the Fajitas Tejanas, the chicken was dried, the meat was tough and over cooked and she had waaay more veggies then anything else. The bride and her mother had the Shrimp & Mussels Moqueca, they did not like it, i was told it was not good but we were all hungry so we ate. Oh i did have the Manchego Spinach Salad - Baby spinach, sliced Spanish Manchego cheese,
smoked bacon, shredded green apples, chipotle-bacon vinaigrette. that salad was amazing. only thing that was good for me was the salad.

Starting off a little bad I went for breakfast and was five minutes and couldn't order it at all because I couldn't get sat quick enough. Instead of breakfast I started with a Calamari & Shrimp Cocktail that was extremely good and very spicy! And I usually prefer the kick so I was surprised. The fajitas were extremely juicy and tender. The rice was okay, a little bland but overall very great meal!

Cañonita is undoubtedly the best restaurant I've ever been to. The food here is so delicious that it brought tears to both my sister and I. I highly recommend this place to everyone. Everything we ordered was utterly breath taking. (I recommend the roasted corn.)
Unexpected - very good!  Usually Vegas Strip restaurants are over priced, over hyped with mediocre food - but - Cañonita is one I'll return to.  Good Mexican food, good service.

Great food, I had the 3 taco, Cilantro & Lime Rice, with black beans. It was VERY good! My uncle had the Enchiladas dish with beans & rice which he liked very much! We were seated right along the Canal which was great too! We also happen to catch "Happy Hour" and got $5 Margarita's which how couldn't you love that!?!? The prices were great it's a must try!!
Juan Carlos was fantastic - he recommended the Barbacoa dinner which was absolutely amazing!  Flavors reminiscent of eating in Mexico City.  Ask for Juan and order this dinner!

Would give zero stars if possible.  Waited 10 min to be greated once seated.  No water no nothing.  Waited came and we ordered chips and guacamole and 2 Margs.  Again a 10 min wait.  We ordered food and that took 25 minutes.  No visit from
Waiter no courtesy checks, just simply
Awful wait and awful service.  Sad part is... the food was great!  There were open tables so this wasn't due to a crowded house, this is due to poor mgmt and low expectations from those working.  Won't be back

This is by far, my favorite Mexican restaurant. I have been here at least once for every visit that I have made to Las Vegas, to mark the completeness of my time spent in the desert :) I have brought several friends, and they are as pleased as I am. I remember my first time dining here, as someone at a nearby table attempted to order a chimichanga. The server said to me "this is Mexican SOUL food! None of that Taco Bell stuff..", and he was right. Everything here (from the fabulous choices of margarita, to the horchata and desserts), is SOOO finger-licking good. After one visit, I had finally had enough of being without my favorite horchata, and asked the chef for a recipe. Not only did he write it down for me, but he emailed it to me as well! As I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering..but I know that nothing in Seattle will compare to this food.

We enjoyed this restaurant. It has a nice location along the canal inside the shopping corridors of the Venetian. There are not really any walls in the dining area of this restaurant but some tables are located under a roof of this restaurant while others are "outside" under the high blue roof of the Venetian.  The atmosphere is nice. It is somewhat loud because let's face it, you are basically in the middle of a mall.  The food was quite good with a variety of rather unique twists on traditional mexican food. The portions were adequate but not ridiculous.  Prices were typical of the Vegas factor - higher than what they should be for what you get but weren't outrageous.  I'd return to this restaurant.

Full Disclosure: When I visited Canonita I had already eaten, so I only sampled the salsa and drinks. However, I had a great time here! 
Located in the Venetian right off the water, the ambiance is great and you are right in the middle of excellent shopping and yet are eating Mexican food while in "Venice." However, while some people found the singing Gondoliers charming, they were a bit obnoxious for us. Different strokes I guess. I sampled the drink in the coconut (don't remember the name), and a habanero margarita. My drinks were delicious and the coconut drink was awesome as well. We also had a great server and I enjoyed hanging out here on a Sunday morning while the boys were enjoying the football game. 
Overall, I had a good time here and would come back when I'm back at the Venetian!

This is a great restaurant option at the Venetian.  We came here twice for breakfast this last weekend as it's one of the few, surprisingly, good restaurants open for breakfast.  All the food was really good and they make all their own tortillas.  They've got a bottomless mimosa bar where you actually make the mimosas yourself.  None of this bottomless-but-we'll-start-putting-less-champagne-in-it-each-time mimosa business.  Reasonably priced and relatively private too to get away from the hustle and bustle.

*This review is for breakfast only*

I feel like I discovered this joint deep in the Venetian/Palazzo labyrinth!
You could pretty much walk by (or float by in one of the gondolas) and not notice it amongst all the colorful background action going on, but you'd be wise to track it down next time you're at the Venetian. Beautiful, open restaurant with a nice bar and lots of seating right along the canal.

WHEN YOU GO- I love eating breakfast right at the bar. Feels so decadent! Plus you always get great service because the bartenders are prepping for the day and not dealing with drunks.
The Short Rib Chilaquillas are a must try. Cheesy, spicy with perfectly marinated chips, this dish is without a doubt my favorite. The omelets and breakfast burritos are very good as well. Fantastic, friendly service by all + very good house coffee makes this spot my go- to for breakfast when at the Venetian!
Service was good but when you pay 20 something for shrimp tacos I expect more than shrimp and a tortilla with like 2 pieces of cilantro.

We stopped here for dinner one night while visiting in Las Vegas. The restaurant is located by the gondola canal in the Venetian, so it was a nice view from our table. For drinks, I ordered the sangria de Rojo which is just sangria mixed with margarita. I could only stand to drink two sips because it was soooo tart. I usually love my drinks more on the tart side but this was just too much. My husband ordered the margarita flight and seemed to enjoy it. We ordered chips and salsa for an appetizer. The salsa was pretty good but the chips were way too salty. On the plus side, both of our entrees were great! I kept it simple by ordering chicken quesadillas and my husband had the mushroom enchiladas.  Overall, it was just okay.

Lovely location on the Canal.  Classic margaritas are tangy with fresh lime juice, some of the best I've had. Queso Fundido comes with freshly made tortillas. A bit heavy on the fresh cilantro, but that may just be me. Hubby loved the mushroom enchiladas, I somewhat enjoyed the shrimp burrito. Shell was drier than I'm accustomed to in a burrito, but the filling was good. The cilantro lime rice was fresh and well-cooked.

A couple nights ago my friend who is the Beverage manager at the Taqueria Cañonita invited my friends and I to an event to celebrate the new concept and remodeling that had taken place here. I had been to the Cañonita and the food had been good and the locale is in a prime spot for people-watching. Since it is right next to the Canal in the Venetian, you get to watch the gondolas go by while you sit at one of their tables "outside". Now the restaurant has been remodeled and it looks great. The changes are small and discreet, let getting rid of some paitings and adding more light fixtures, etc. But it really looks nice. They painted sectionsof the walls above the kitchen turquoise green and it brightens up the space. On the outside patio there are now umbrellas and little tables that lend it a casual and inviting scene. 

They were serving ahi tuna on plaintain chips; the tuna was fresh and delicious. The pork empanadas, short rib on tortilla chip and the albondigas con papa were all very good, and very addictive. There was also a fried avocado with sesame seed (I think sesame seed) that was kind of like a Mexican tempura. The shrimp skewers were kind of difficult to eat the way they were placed on the stick, but were good also. They were served very interesting though, stuck into a big piece of pineapple. Cool presentation. 

At the far end of the restaurant they had a couple of people preparing tacos to your liking; they offered carne asada, chicken, carnitas and a couple of different meats. I went with the carnitas, they were very good. They also had different toppings and salsas to add on as well. Oh and for dessert they had pastel de tres leches. Now, any of my friends will tell you that when it comes to dessert, although I have a tremendous sweet tooth, I am still kind of picky. I don't like flan, jello or anything that's too moist, like pastel de tres leches. However, I had been snacking on salty food (and plenty or margaritas) for two hours straight (thanks Alex!) and was open to try a bite for the sugar rush. I must say it was quite good, what won me over was the strawberry jelly. I would recommend you try it. 

The food is is supposed to be Mexico City soul food, I don't know if the mean like cocinas economicas or what. I'm not sure if it's particularly chilango food per se, maybe they should add some huitlacoche, flor de calabaza, etc. But all in all the food is very good and quite affordable if you consider where the restaurant is located. As they say, location, location, location.

Great place! It is easily located. Great seating area. You can see so much. Wonderful selection on food! The sangria is delicious. The service is wonderful. The guacamole is so good. I would come back for sure.
The food looked so delicious, I was pretty upset when I didn't enjoy my order. We ended up sending our orders back to get different entrees, but it still didn't really taste that good.

The food was fantastic!!!  Really, I don't know what more I can say.  I ordered fish tacos--huge meaty pieces of fish in tiny little tortillas.  So good!!  We ordered a bottle of homemade sangria.  It was only $20, and was enough for four full glasses and refills!!  I love the fact that it's right on the edge of the gondola river running throughout the Grand Canal Shoppes.  The end of the river is right at the restaurant so all the gondoliers would pause to serenade their riders and the crowd.  I think people at the restaurant should be given point cards so we can rate the singing.  It's sad, but some of the gondoliers shouldn't sing.  Others were so amazing that their voices echoed off the walls!!

Ok. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing here. I dunno. But I was NOT pleased. Not at all. 

I am from LA and I know Mexican. And this place is not Mexican. It's something like what Midwesterners want Mexican to be. I knew I was in trouble when I saw that the the Fish tacos were served with a Chipotle Mayo type thing. Yuck. That is not authentic. 

So I ordered the Sopa de Tortilla. A dish I love to order in Mexican restaurants. Not terrible, but not balanced and it really tasted only like a bowl of chili. Eh.

Then my friend ordered the 6 taco platter and I tried the Rajas and Mushroom tacos. Blech. No flavor. Plus (and I hate when restaurants do this) although the menu stated the Rajas Tacos came with Queso Fresco (versus just queso), when it came it was melted Jack Cheese.   That is not Queso Fresco. I guess they don't expect people to know the difference!

The only reason I am giving the 2 stars and not 1 is because their house  made salsa was pretty good. Thank god for that, because it was the only way to flavor the tacos!
Great food and service. The pina coladas are amazing! A must visit! Love the environment and dessert selection.

Reserved a table for Friday night for 8 people. The house was pretty full but the noise level was not too bad. We had seating on the patio, but because we were on the far end near the shops I almost wish we had just taken a table inside because you couldn't see the water anyway. Just something to consider when you have a large guest- you will not be right by the water. 

The food is not good enough to make me want to come back and I think more than a few people were a little disappointed in their dishes. I will say though that if you are looking for a spot that does Mexican dishes a little differently, with a creative twist, this might be your place. 

I will mention that the hosts were very friendly but our main serve did not make me feel comfortable.

Very disappointed. ... We came here for there so called best micheladas. Omg by far the worse. It's nothing but lemon juice, Salt and beer. There's  no clamato or  Tabasco sauce or etc.there food had no flavor. But I do give them one star because it has an amazing view.

One of our meet up places for my family reunion, the food was pretty good and the service was amazing!  We arrived with a party of 12 and ordered a few appetizers; floutas, nachos and with Salsa.  

I ordered the 3 taco meal that allows for a choice of beef, chicken, shrimp, or pork.  I just ordered all of mine with shrimp which also came with a side of rice and beans for $20.99.  My dish looked amazing but lacked flavor so I used the green and regular salsa on top.  Honesty, the 3 tacos filled me up and I barely touched the sides.  

Our waiter was very attentive to our table and paid attention with refilling our glasses.  He also checked up on us often to ensure we were happy with our meals.  His service was great and deserves as 5 star rating.

As far as location, it's perfect; especially if you enter through the Venetian entrance near Madame Tussaud's.  It's right next to the Gondola rides inside the Mall area.  We enjoyed the singing and views!  Check out the place, the margaritas looked good!
Slow service. We sat at the table 15 minutes before we got noticed. They made up for it with free bloody Mary's. Food was pretty good, Huevas rancheros and Chilaquiles

This is woefully overdue. I had thought I'd saved the updated review months ago. I'm embarrassed to discover now that it never posted. My apologies.

___________________________

Where to begin? How about the service? As mentioned before, it was the service on follow-up that convinced me to come back to Cañonita and give them another chance. And it's generally more about the service than anything else when I consider how I feel about my experience at a restaurant. 

Rarely if ever have I been so pleased to be turned around on my opinion of a restaurant.  To say that Alejandro and his staff treated my guests and me like treasured friends would be an understatement. Now I know full well that they were looking to make up for a previous poor experience but I was watching the scene throughout the restaurant and, well, it wasn't just us. The staff was attentive and welcoming to everybody, and I could see lots of smiles and hear lots of laughter throughout the restaurant. This was what had been lacking the first time. Yes, the food was a major FAIL then, but it was the service that caused much of the problem. And it was the follow-up by Alejandro that had started to turn me around. This was five star, white glove service. Perfection.

As for the food, it was nothing short of spectacular. I can be a bit of a food snob at times. Okay, maybe more than a bit. But my daughter still talks about her fish from that night. High praise from a picky pescatarian about the fish she essentially HAD to order because there weren't exactly a lot of choices available to her. It made her old man smile from ear to ear. Her attitude went from "do we really have to go back there?" to "when can we go back there again?" I tasted it. It melted like butter in my mouth. My steak was heavenly but her fish was truly incredible. I wanted to steal it from her. All of the dishes were brilliantly prepared and beautifully presented. Everything about our meal was close to perfect - the atmosphere, the service, the food, the drinks. I even enjoyed the desserts - and I'm not really a huge desserts guy.  

Alejandro, thank you. You and your staff have restored my faith and we WILL be back.  

______________________

Okay, so that's what has been unwittingly stuck as a draft since the end of November.   And if you want to know if we're still thinking about that meal, well.... My birthday's coming up and my kids asked to go back to Vegas to celebrate. (In the summer. Yeah, I know!) My daughter was quick to insist that we go to Cañonita for my birthday dinner. She still talks about that fish seven months later. My son suggested Cañonita too, and he wasn't even with us in November. He's been listening to his sister rave about her meal for months. As for me, well, who am I to argue? Cañonita it is. I think maybe I'll order the fish....

Stopped in here a few times when we were too hungry & buzzed to walk far or wait in line anywhere.  I need chips and salsa like chain smokers need a Marlboro. Chips, salsa and guac were all satisfying, I asked for their hottest sauce and it satisfied my taste buds. Tacos were decent...it's a Mex joint in a mall in Vegas so I didn't have super high expectations but overall it always good as was the service.

I thought it was rather funny to have a traditional Mexican restaurant in the Venetian... and right on the canal too!  But it's Vegas so I rolled with it.

The food was surprisingly delicious, but the service was a little iffy....  just slow and it seemed like a long conversation just to put one order in.  Despite the speed, the food came out perfect.  And I scarfed down what I could of my beef enchiladas.  The entrées come with black beans and cilantro rice, which were awesome, but there was too much of it.  I always feel bad when I leave food on my plate.

We had just seen our boy, Pacquiao win his title event on the casino floor which was invigorating, but we were also starving too.    Since we were so hungry... I think that made it seem like the service was slower, but looking at our watches afterward... we did kill a whole bunch of time just sitting there and eating.

We also ordered chips and guacamole... which were nice and hot and good.  

Overall it was a good meal and it was nice sitting next to the canal and hearing the gondoliers sing their songs to the couples riding in the boats.
Good mexican chicken enhiladas and a mojito by the venetian canal - good for watching the gondoliers singing at the tourists.

My wife ordered the pozole and I got the scrumptious shrimp burrito that came with black beans and cilantro dyed rice.  My wife who is a pozole aficionado said her pozole was better than home made. Drinks I got the signature margarita that packed a punch with single shot of premier tequila. Felt great after that drink.
Chips came with fresh guacamole and salsa. Our service was serious not much of any smiles but he took our order with strict efficiency. Nice view of the gondolas passing under you and love the low noise level. Salsa is American style meaning it won't burn your tongue like the authentic Mexican hot salsa. Las Vegas style Mexican cuisine at its best.

Used to be a favorite in Vegas. Hadn't been in a long time but did not disappoint. The Queso Fundido app is still great especially hot with the jalapeños. Some of my favorite dishes have been the chile relleno, the fajitas, and the carne asada. I got a burrito last time out and tweaked it by subbing the mole sauce. it was great. 

Details:

Place is found in the Grand Canal Shoppes at Venetian. It's not too expensive and one of the few decent sit down Mexican joints on the strip. Margaritas are awesome and the drinks are not at all watered down. 

Service is very good. Never had an issue. 

On busy weekends make a reservation through Yelp or Open Table ahead of time. 

Enjoy!!!

In a word: WHACK. This place was such a bust. Food was really bad and the service was even worse...Honestly, i dont get it. The only reason i gave 2 stars instead of 1 is the location. Its in the Venetian and its right on the canal. But man , outside of that we were left really underwhelmed. Our server was a phantom . We would have to  flag him down multiple times and ask for something like salsa,  and then he would vanish and totally forget to bring whatever we asked for... ....then when we finished we asked for a to-go cup for my wifes beer (you can do that in Vegas) and hes like: 'sure BRB'.....and then disappeared quietly into the night never to be seen again....... granted this was our only experience at this restaurant so maybe it was a fluke but Considering how many fantastic dining options there are in vegas, we would for sure not be returning here...

Classic margarita was 100% agave with housemade mix.  Too sweet, but adjusted to my taste on request.  It lost some flavor in the process.  Certainly not the worst margarita i've had, and it was only $5.  Wild mushroom enchiladas were nutritious and delicious, if not scrumptious.  Pinto beans were a tad undercooked, but in a positive way that added nice texture.  Lots of interesting pork options for next time.

Ate a late dinner there and had excellent enchiladas!  The rice and beans were very good too!  I loved that they had a happy hour starting at 9 pm with  delicious $5 margaritas.  I will go back on my next visit to the Venetian.

We were originally trying to go to this italian place we like which is just a few stores down and they had a 30 or more minute wait so we walked around looking to see if anything else caught our eye. We decided to try Canonita and were happy with our experience. We got a cheese appetizer that came with tortillas which was really good and decided to split a meal since we were going to go get a milkshake after. we got the enchiladas with green sauce. the enchiladas came with rice and beans. and The enchiladas were good but the RICE was amazing! it was cilantro rice and I could have just eaten a meal filled with that.

Enchiladas verdes OMG the best ones I've ever tried in the states 

Very good service as well!!! Very cozy place for a nice and romantic dinner!

Best Mexican food in Vegas!
Inside Venetian watching the grandolier pass by with their passenger !

A wonderful experience, as always!  The food is delicious, and the environment is fantastic. Fantastic view of the canal and we loved watching the boats go up and down the canal. 

Special shoutout to Ashley, the best waitress ever!

Surprise! Surprise! 
I am meeting some friends for a reunion dinner. The Italian restaurant we were going to had an hour wait, so the group settled for Taqueria Canonita. It was Friday, the place is pretty pack but I am still second guessing the quality of food since this restaurant is located inside the mall. 
I ordered... 
Mojito $9 - Sugar rim and very sugary with very little herbs NASTY! I had to returned it and replace it with a soft drink 
Pork Tender $20 - Very good... the pork is moist and tender... the dressing is fruity with just the right amount of saltiness

Atmosphere - Fun
Service - Average... we have to wave down our waiter for every needs (i.e water refill) and requests, etc.
Price - Fair for Vegas

Note:  18% Gratuity added to party of six or more

My favorite Mexican restaurant on the strip.  Our waiter Nathan gave us first class service.  The food and drinks were delicious.  This was my second time here and will be looking forward to my third visit.

Went here on a first date, decent food, friendly attentive staff, beautiful view of the water way, and perfect temperature to exs pace the Vegas heat. 

Only downside, difficult to locate

Date night with my cute cute!!! Love the location, but the food good not great. The queso dip was really yummy and the trio of ceviches was good in theory but one of the 3 tasted funny and left me feeling under the weather :( I had a sub par salad as my main course and my husband had some sort of burrito with some very good rice and beans. Probably won't go back next time I'm in Vegas.

We dropped by Canonita wanted to grab a quick dinner before going to Tao night club, and this is going to be our MUST stop next time we're in Vegas.
We got Santa Rosa Barbacoa de Puerco and Carne Asada Nortena. Both were AMAZINGLY delicious! I've had quite a fair share of Mexican food, but this was surprisingly delightful. The sweet chipotle BBQ sauce perfectly complimented the Barbacoa. I didn't care much for the cilantro rice and bean though, but the meat was more than enough to satisfy my appetite. Boyfriend was in love with the angus steak, cooked to perfection. His plate was completely empty in 20 minutes.
Our waiter was very friendly and helpful in explaining the menu. The food also came out pretty quickly.
Sitting next to gondolas passing through underneath the painted sky is so cool!  The food is delicious.  Cheese dip is a great appetizer.  Tacos and enchiladas are great dinner choices.

A great dining option located in the shops at the Venetian right along the canal.  Pretty standard Mexican menu offerings, but they are all of decent portion size and quality.  The chips and dip were tasty and fresh and the Quesadilla I ordered had great filling and came with a healthy side of beans and rice.  The service was quick and friendly and the ambiance of being seated next to the canal so you could see the gondolas go by added that much more to the experience here.

Come hungry, or don't fill up on the chips and salsa! Generous portions rule the day here. The Wild Mushroom Enchilada was perfection. And the Chile Relleno looked good enough to marry. The service was friendly and efficient as well. And a "canal" view, too!

Really good service as well as dishes and drinks at Happy HOur. The staff was extremely nice and helpful; moreover, very patient with us. 
Dish: Chile Relleno -- Yes, 6/10 for a good solid dish
Drink: Bloody Mary -- 4/10, its alright... I'll pass
Fast and decent food. I would come here if I was hungry in the area. 
Pros: Quality and staff
Cons: Price for dishes are a little on the high side. 
STARS: 3.75

Review #700, I'm taking it on the road! Canonita is well worth the trip. Of course, if you're staying at The Venetian, it's as close as the gondolas. 

Came here for a party and was delighted from the word 'Go'. Mind you, I kinda stopped with the Mexican food thing because it's so often so mediocre (and that's in any city). And, truly, not the healthiest. But Canonita blew up both of my prejudices.

* Margaritas. Yes, very tasty and potent without knocking me over. Enjoyed the balance of sweetness to citrusy tartness. Mmm. (And they gave us cups for when we later taxi'd off to Karaoke.)
* Chips and guac. The chips were tasty, with just enough crisp and just enough salt, and certainly no oily residue. The guacamole was damn good -- thick and tasty, without a lot of mysterious ingredients. Straightforward and delish. 
*Filet Mignon was my choice (could have also gone for Salmon or a chicken dish). Lovely 8 oz I think was the weight. Don't bother requesting a temp for your meat, because the kitchen really doesn't think know what's best. Happily, we were of the same mind in term of heat: Medium Rare and loving it. Wonderful flavors that I frankly can't recall (I mentioned the margaritas, right?). If you at all interested in steak, this is a worthy choice for your entree.

I must say the dessert was fine, but anticlimactic. Really not necessary. However, I did have a brownie sundae which definitely didn't hurt anything - except maybe my waistline.

Service was pleasant and attentive without being all over us. Water was refilled as necessary, which for me, is fairly often. 

Overall, I was most surprised that the Yelp reviews seemed so unenthusiastic. I would absolutely recommend Canonita, and if you do sit 'outside' by the gondolas, you don't even notice them. Gracias! Muchas gracias!

Visit this place once for the experience if not the food. the place has a festive charm with amazing view of gondoliers singing and sailing their gondolas with couples (or tourists).
However the place is pricier than $$ sign displayed next to the restaurant name in yelp- specially when you adds a drink/cocktail to your order. But liked speedy Gonzalez ;)
We specially enjoyed Chile Relleno, that not only tasted good but also looked pretty. 
On the other hand I personally hated myself for ordering queso fundido- could have been  better off with just the chips and salsa.

Great meal here and very convenient if you're a guest at Venetian. Ate dinner here. We had the chips, salsa and guacamole appetizer - good portion, we brought the leftover chips back to the room to snack on later. Standout appetizer is the mussels and shrimp with chorizo. I think we only had two pieces of shrimp but the mussels were generous and the chorizo sauce was amazing. The dish needed more bread to soak up the sauce. My boyfriend had the pork barbacoa and said it was delicious. Would definitely return.

FAQ

Q: Mexican food inside the Venetian. Doesn't that strike you as odd?
A: A city built in the middle of the desert that thrives on gambling and entertainment (adult and otherwise)? A fake Champs Elysees on Las Vegas Blvd.? A city where public intoxication on the main street is okay as long as you're not stumbling and puking? Doesn't that strike you as odd?

No. Of course not. It's Vegas (obligatory: baby)!

Q: How is the sangria here?
A: Oh! I'm glad you asked. It is absolutely delicious. Chilled to perfection. Nice large chunks of fruit in there. Get a pitcher. Get two! Thank me later! I don't have sangria often but this is the benchmark on which all other sangria pitchers will be judged.

Q: Woah, this looks like it's right next to the canal, right?
A: Totally! It's good times. Be bold, heckle the tourists and the gondola operator.

FYI ... Good times, good people, good location, good food, good booze. No hassles? 5-stars!
This place was really good! The food was awesome and the portions are huge. It's a bit pricey, but overall I would go back again. Great place to stop and eat if you're shopping in the forum shops.

This was an almost daily happy hour haunt for me on my week long Vegas voyage and I'm really upset I didn't get to eat an actual meal here. So this review is mostly for the bar.

The happy hour is from 3-6pm and 9pm-close. $3 wells and beers and $5 margaritas and specialty drinks, one of which was a Long Island Iced Tea! 

There is a bartender who is there almost daily and while he is seemingly polite and friendly he is absolutely buried all the time. Hire this guy some help! And be nice to him, he works hard.

The margaritas are pretty good, not quite as artisinal as some places but good ingredients and a nice amount of the strong stuff. The long islands are served in a short glass but have plenty of kick for the price. Just a great spot to start the day-drinking off right.

The food I was lucky enough to try was awesome. The salsa is made with roasted chilis and has an amazing depth of flavor. Some of my favorite ever. The queso is ridiculous. Get it with the jalapenos and bask in a bowl of awesome cheese. I do wish they gave you more tortillas with it. If you combine it with the salsa you will not be disappointed.

Everything else on the menu sounded really awesome and I will have to eat an actual meal here on my next trip out. It's a favorite.

Excellent service! Made it on time for their happy hour! We were immediately greeted and attended. Very authentic flavor, we had the chorizo gordita and beef flautas. Can't beat the 5$ happy hour margaritas. Great place with great scenery
Well the portions are pretty huge but for the price it's kinda meh? Part of that is just the cost of doing biz in vegas I suppose but you can do better in this town.

We went here for happy hour drinks and appetizers. The drinks and food was decent. However, the reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because of the terrible service. We had an awful waiter who was not polite at all and not good at his job. He messed up our checks twice, did not communicate prices or specials well, and took forever to come to our table even though there were barely any people there. Do not recommend this place.

Fantastic breakfast! Great food and great service with an incredible ambiance! We had a beautiful morning breakfast early at this great spot. 

I had the special and my Mother had the Clasico eggs and bacon. 

The coffee is wonderful and our server Clint was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. 

Thank you for a great start to the day!

Absolutely delicious!  Had dinner meeting here and had table of 20. Specific menu with  appetizers, salad and 4 entrees. The queso fundido and empanada appetizers were so good!  Loved my spinach salad and the salmon and sweet corn were to die for. I only wish I didn't eat so many chips with guacamole and appetizers so I could of eaten all my salmon and corn!  The sweet corn was so good!  Definitely worth a stop next time in Vegas!
I love sitting at this restaurant and enjoying the sounds of the gondola singers as they float by the table!

What an amazing location, these guys have the best view (feels like in Italy, eating Tasty Mexican food). Venice feels great, when you get a seat munching on food right next to water with singing people and tourists. 
I m late reviewing this place and it's food, probably missed it amidst the glitter of Las Vegas.
