The food here is good, and we also tried some margaritas to go with our food, which were a bit disappointing. Couldn't taste much alcohol in them, so had them get a new order, which were far more improved version. 
The food was good, but nothing out of the world. We tried tres leeches which was just ok, expected it too be better, but too much orange killed it. 
I wished the food was a bit better as the location and service were excellent. Would like to come here and try something new next time, the vibe is just amazing.
If I was basing my rating on the food I would give it just 2 stars but the setting right next to the canal is so fantastic that I need to give it 3.

The ladyfriend and I ate here one night while walking around the strip and had a great meal.  While Canonita is basically inside of a mall, it also sits on the canal that the gondolas of the Venetian turn around.  This can be romantic, comical and cheesy at the same time.  I mean the atmosphere is supposed to be of Venice, Italy but you are eating tacos with a Sketchers in the background lol.  

We started off with the guac and chips.  They do not do the whole free chips and salsa thing.  The guacamole was fresh and had a little spicy kick to it.  I also decided to order a flight of margaritas. Did you read that?  A FLIGHT OF MARGARITAS!!!  It comes with 3 margaritas: a classic on the rocks, a pineapple and a jalapeno.  The jalapeno was very spicy and harder to get down than the other 2.  The classic was very heavy on lime.  For an entrée I got the Pollo Mole Poblano.  I love chicken with mole sauce and get it anytime I see it.  This one had poblano peppers in the sauce so it tasted spicier than usual.  It came with a seasoned rice and mixed veggies.  Definitely a great meal.

If you are looking for Mexican while on the Vegas strip, this is worth a stop for sure.

Had to be one of the best quick bite tacos in Vegas... Great taste... each bite had down home flavor. Not much for service because we used the taco truck side, just order and pick up. A must try before you hit the casino floor

This was delicious! 4.75!!!!! The mole was really authentic Mole.  The fish was succulent and the kale (substituted for the beans) cooked but still crunchy. The corn was Mexico city Authentico!  Orale!! If you KNOW Mexican cuisine, THIS will make you contento. Disfrutalo! Oh yeah, my margarita hit the spot too.

I'd come back for sure! Perfecto.

I was disappointed after reading all the great reviews. Maybe it was an off-day, maybe because I'm used to really good, authentic Mexican food being from So. Cal and living in Phoenix, but the food was sub-par and over cooked. My friend got the chicken enchiladas and I got the chicken fajitas. Both tasted dry, chewy and not very flavorful. Afterwards, we both got really horrible (read: painful) gas bubbles, which isn't normal after I eat Mexican. So, for the price, I expected much better food that doesn't cause discomfort. Plus: great agua frescas.
I eat here at least once every time I'm in Vegas. It is great to be able to sit "outside" no matter the weather. The service is always attentive. The food is always great.
Delicious mexican food.  Great service, but the highlight was Cherrie our server.  She was an absolute joy.  Thank you.  Sean and Trevor

Really loved this place!

For drinks, we ordered the jalapeño margarita and it was really good.  For food, we ordered a guac for the table and it was delightful.  My mom and I split the vegetarian enchiladas and the sauce was fantastic.  I almost wish I had my own plate of enchiladas instead of sharing but it was probably good I didn't (I had already eaten enough chips and guac by that point :) ).  My dad ordered the mahi mahi and he said it was very fresh, tasty, and light. 

Our server Danielle was wonderful; she made sure to check in with us a lot, she was I eat about what was vega and what was not, and she was fun.

Note: the restaurant charges for all additional sauces, so don't be shocked when the bill comes.

I really like how this place has a lot of veg options that are delicious. Would definitely return again!

Really cool place and friendly. The location is awesome, because it's located along the Venetian's "Grand Canal." They also offer bottomless mimosas for breakfast, which is always fun!

During our stay at the Venetian, we came here several times. It's conveniently located near all the shops, singing gondoliers, and close to the casino. The reason I give them three stars, however, is because of the consistently slow service, despite how busy or slow it was, or time of day. At each visit, and with all different servers each time, it always took a long time to be greeted at our table, brought water, food, or drinks. 

Otherwise, it's worth a shot. I would come back.
Dessert is perfect ! Service is great. The best dinner so far in Las Vegas .

Right on the canal.. not too far from the parking garage... I found this sweet spot who was having an awesome happy hour.

Wells, margaritas, and beer all for $5 or less.  And if you get every item off their happy hour list.. $5 each.. you can probably get away with a bill of $30.  Amazing!

And it's elegant... so it's not like the food court nearby where there is also happy hour specials but not nearly as satisfying.

I don't know how this nice, but not too expensive restaurant right on the canal in The Venetian got so overlooked, but the three of us were seated right away on Valentine's Day.  We weren't in the "patio" (along the canal), but were beneath a graceful arch and close enough to see the gondolas drifting by - actually they were maneuvering quite a bit because it's near the embarkation point.  In fact, the only thing separating us was a small group celebrating a wedding - I thought it a very suitable venue for a Vegas reception....more of a choice to forego the big church wedding and Italian honeymoon instead of a we-can't-afford-it substitute.  Well, that's the vibe I got since they had obviously put in a lot of attention to detail with the nicest spot, table set up, cake table, etc.  Well, it lent some romance to our dinner since we weren't a menage a trois, but there with our teenage son.  The menu was very tempting - there were a few things we couldn't decide between.  Looking over at the next table, I recommended that my son order a dish full of shell fish, chicken skewers, and delicious looking bread; it turned out not to be quite enough for him.  The ceviche appetizer was sufficient as an entree for me though - the tuna was good, the shrimp and olive too salty, and the third not memorable.  Oh, another diner came over and asked me what I thought of it, so the dishes match the menu description very accurately!  My husband had the succulent pork, and we shared a carafe of strong (I felt) sangria.  It would have been nice if chips and salsa were included instead of being offered separately on the menu (duh, restaurateurs, I probably could have handled more sangria then).  I'm recommending it for kids also because watching the boats is pretty entertaining, it's noisy anyway, and I imagine the railings are close enough that they can't slip through.  I think this place was mentioned in one of the in-room magazines, but in this case, it wasn't all hype.  Besides the tastiness, the setting and presentation make it truly special.

One of the best casual meals I've had in Vegas. 

I was wandering around killing time, looking for a Sunday brunch spot and decided to eat here in a whim. I was very pleasantly surprised. 

Jesus, my server, was attentive, but not annoying.  I was indecisive with my order. I asked about the short ribs and he mentioned the chiliquiles. I love chilequiles and was not disappointed. They were exactly what I was craving. 

The pomegranate margarita was wonderfully tart and very strong. 

I was impressed with the fast, attentive service. 

I will definitely return, and recommend friends go here.

Went for breakfast. The tables overlooking the water only sat two people and we had three but that was fine. My husband got the breakfast burrito and I got the sandwich with fried eggs instead of scrambled. I forgot what my daughter got but you will see it in the photos. Had a nice mimosa. The food was very good and our particular server was nice. My daughter is a very successful food/lifestyle blogger in NYC so when the food came out she took our plates to an EMPTY table by the water to do a 2 minute shoot for her blog which would have been free advertising for the place. A lady came over.I don't know if she was a server or the manager and blessed her out, saying loudly, you can't do that . Move that stuff right now! Talk about rude! My daughter tried to explain, but this woman was not hearing it. She kept repeating now we will have to reset this table! Really lady. Nobody is eating here. I wanted to just leave but we stayed. I guess this blog will be different than the one last week where she was invited to The James Beard House. Inexcusable behavior.

Exceptional food with an amazing ambience !!! We ordered the chille relleno and the chicken quesadilla along with guacamole and chips and an omelet. Everything was finger licking good. The lattes were perfect and so was the mimosa. The soothing water by the side is a perfect place to have your brunch. All in all a fantastic experience. Will surely visit again.

STAY AWAY FROM THE CEVICHE. Play it safe at this place. chicken, pork steak. the Ceviche tastes like fish dick. the drinks are good too and they have a good selection of tequila, just don't expect much from the food. think El Torito.

Cañonita is all about the atmosphere ! And the great ends there. 

Pros: beautiful location right next to the canals! 
Decorated beautifully 

Cons: food leaves on a mediocre note. 
Service subpar. 

Booking a reservation through open table was a breeze and was honored when I showed up. And the good service comes to an end right there. Being seated right next to the canal was something very beautiful that you can only do in Vegas. Lights hang above your head and overall it really is a beautiful location. But the food does not match anything close to the decor. You'd expect amazing food at a prime spot at one of the world's largest hotels. Unfortunately not so much at this place. Not horrid, but definitely not wow. The fajitas were just there. You're tasting the steak the peppers the onions, but where's the wow ? Where's the melting in your mouth? Where's the mmm? Perhaps the waiter took it along with the what seems to look like a place with awesome service on the outside. Not too attentive despite a not so busy day. When asked for lemon or anything else to be brought at the table it took a good 10 minutes for the waiter to come around again. All in all was checked up on once. I suppose the service matches the food. Mediocre. It is a true travesty both could not match what is other wise a beautiful restaurant in a prime location. Do I recommend it ? It depends , what's your definition of a memorable restaurant experience while you're on vacation?

I attended a client appreciation reception for an ed tech company at the Canonita a few weeks ago. Our group had the run of the "outdoor" seating area right next to the canal. The atmosphere and wait staff were pleasant - those are the only positives I took away from my experience at this restaurant. 

Since the reception was small and casual, I had the opportunity to try their margaritas and a few appetizers/finger foods. Their margaritas, while potent, were a little bland, and the appetizers were over cooked,  flavorless, and uninspiring. The experience did not make me want to frequent the establishment again.

Very tasty food. I had chicken burrito and it came with rice and beans. The burrito was really tasty. I would come back here and get it again.  Also ordered taco sampler and I tried the beef taco and it was very tasty too. Good food! Not a bad price either considering the size of portions and the taste! Oh and the chips and salsa was great too! Ill be back!
Had lunch here and it was very good. Started with the sashimi tro.  And then moved on to the ahi tuna that was fabulous. We tried the margarita on the rocks and they were very good.

I got the breakfast tacos, the "Chef's Special" of the day. Fantastic. Soft corn tortillas with eggs, meat, onion, guacamole and pico. It came with a side of cheesy breakfast potatoes. Very filling! I would definitely come here again. 

It is a little noisy but so are all the restaurants here. Many of the tables sit right on the water so you can listen to the gondolier singers as they bring their customers up and down the little indoor river. I would definitely eat here again.

This is for the taco truck.

Stopped by because it looked neat and I saw sangria on the menu.
SO GLAD I stopped, this was probably one of the best sangrias that I have ever had.  This will be a stop whenever walking through the shops here.  Next time, when hungry we will grab some tacos too!
Awesome food, fresh homemade tortillas, great margaritas and great service!  Nathan is awesome.  Ask for his table.  Also ask for extra spicy green salsa!  Yummmm
Absolutely horrible. Food was less than mediocre, poor service, overall worst dining experience I've ever had in Vegas. You're much better off in the food court. Stay away.

When our tired feet could not walk another step we stumbled in for beverages and a appetizer but decided to stay for dinner when we saw the menu.  We started with delicious agave margaritas which were delicious bit pricey.  We shared the empanadas (good) and flautas (spectacular).  I had the beef rib and polenta which was rich and delicious.  The huge chunks of tomato on top were off putting and marinated in something that made them too acidic.  My man child had chorizo appetizer for his meal which was incredible.  Our other dining companion had the carne Asada which he enjoyed thourghly.  5 stars for service which was helpful with recommendations and kept my water full which is important in a desert!

We visited Canonita back in April during an anniversary trip when we stayed at the Venetian.  We tried 6 of the Venetian restaurants on this trip, and this was one of two that we really enjoyed.

Our waiter was Jesus, and he was excellent!  He happily recommended menu items for us that turned out to be really great.  He was very attentive throughout the entire meal.  We had a seat right next to the canal, so if you enjoy the singing of the gondoliers, it's a nice environment.  They also have seats more inside toward the bar if you don't want to be near the canal.

Appetizer:  Queso Fundido - this was amazing!  We ordered it with chorizo, but I would probably order it with jalapeno as well next time to make it spicy.  It was served with fresh tortillas and we ended up requesting additonal tortillas for it.

Meals:
- Wild Mushroom Enchiladas with poblano chili sauce, cilantro rice, borracho beans (pintos and corn).
- Carne Asada Nortena with black beans, roasted cerranos and garlic, and sweet corn tamales.
- Requested a side of fresh tortillas for this dish also since it was sliced up in a manner similar to a flank steak.  Both meals were presented very nicely and the food was great.

Dessert:
- Tres Leches - very good!

We'll be back the next time we come to Vegas if for nothing else than to order the Queso Fundido again.  The only knock on it was that we had to keep requesting more tortillas because they were really small and we were charged each time we requested them.

The good is really good. Hubby and I staying at the Venetian resort. We had a show at 8pm so decided to eat in the hotel after. This place hit home. The guacamole was awesome. Chips were a but yo heavy for me but tasty.  Salsa was good. Chicken burrito was good with the cilantro rice I was happy with u choice. Hubby had some pork which he ate all of.

I gotta tell you we found this place by accident. We sat next to the Gondola show, it was so cool. But back to the food! Man it was good. I ordered the Chicken Burrito, it was so good. Cilantro flavored rice, black beans, and a mondo sized burrito stuffed with the most tender shredded chicken breast I have ever eaten. I will be back very soon. Oh, the service and staff were top shelf!

Service was terrible. Our server was completely inept, requiring constant reminders for the simplest of requests (e.g., a glass). The food was borderline at best - bland and unremarkable. Overall, the experience will not be bringing us back.

What kind of Mexican place doesn't have chips and queso? Now, don't get me wrong, I liked the queso thingy they had with flour tortillas fine.  But I wanted tortilla chips and queso.  I'm used to chips and salsa coming free in Mexican restaurants too - not here! 

Fajitas were tasty and my friends tacos were good too.  I had some mild heat stuff going on so was practically main lining water and the dude kept up pretty well.  Food came out fairly quick and I loved the ambiance being sat at a table by the water.

Get a table by the water if possible! The ambience is about as good as it gets. Great place for drinks (especially during happy hour). The Chicken Flautas were only average tasting (chicken lacked flavor). Service was impeccable.

I've only been here for happy hour so I can't say too much. The food, eh! We had the queso with chicken and there was about one piece of diced chicken for i think $2 extra, that was a ripoff! The drinks here are pretty good for happy hour and they have it from 4-6 and 9-close (I think those are the hours)

What keeps me coming back is the wonderful location has, and you can be asked to be seated along the water and watch tourists take the gondola ride!

We stopped in again to give them another chance on our last visit to Las Vegas. The food was much better than our last visit. My husband had the pork special and I had tres tacos. We also had guacamole and chips. I think we always have guacamole and chips. The meal was just right and we did enjoy ourselves.

This place is terrible! Service is extremely slow, waitress is inexperienced and easily frazzled, food is just mediocre. 

We had a reservation for lunch at 3pm on the patio to enjoy the ambiance, people watching and gondola rides. We were told it was happy hour. We tried to place an order for a drink that was on the happy hour menu, but were told it was only available in the main dining area, not on the patio. We asked if we could order our drinks in the bar and bring it to our table and our waitress highly discouraged it. We asked if there was something she could do and she said she didn't know. Ok, whatever. We ended up just ordering our drinks through our waitress. We got chips and salsa for the table, but they charge for that. It's not complimentary, like most standard mexican restaurants. 

When placing an order, our waitress kept leaving to go ask questions to the manager. She obviously had no knowledge of the menu. We asked her for a cheese quesadilla with beans on the side and she said they couldn't do that. Huh? Seriously?!? 

We ordered the mushroom enchiladas. 10 minutes later our waitress comes back and says they're out of mushroom enchiladas. So we order a bean burrito with beans and veggies inside. 10 minutes later, a different waitress comes by to tell us they can't do a bean burrito with beans inside because the flour tortilla would become soggy. Ok. So, we asked her what else she had to offer that was vegetarian? She replied mushroom enchiladas. We told her that our previous waitress just told us your kitchen was out of mushroom enchiladas. She simply replied, no, we have it. Ummm....ok. Communication issues much? 

We finally get our food almost an hour and a half after initially being seated. The mushroom enchiladas were good, but nothing to write home about. Guacamole was also tasty, but after dealing with all of the headaches of our waitress and slow service, I can't recommend this restaurant to anyone. Go to Dos Caminos inside The Palazzo instead. You won't get the ambiance, but at least you'll get delicious Mexican food with good service and capable waiters/waitresses.

The best thing about this restaurant is the location. It's very relaxing watching and listening to the gondolas. But the food here is not very good. They say Mexico City cuisine but it's not even close. It's more like a cross between Mexico City cuisine meets American meets Tex mex. The food temperature was almost cold or barley warm. One person in our group is a vegetarian so as part of the 3 dishes he ordered, one was a Cobb salad minus the bacon. Their version is spinach with some shaved cheese and dressing. Last time I ordered a Cobb salad it has tomatoes, eggs, cheese, and a few other thing. We did order the flautas and empanadas as an appetizers.  The flautas were probably the best out of all of our dishes. The empanadas were ok but they had so much sauce in the serving bowl that they were soggy on the bottom. The stuffed chicken was oddly flavored with half the dish being very sweet and have more savory. Very odd. Lastly the staff was not very friendly at all.

Erm....I didn't like this place at all. My friends had visited for breakfast and loved it, but, it fell short for dinner. The waiter made a mistake with our drinks and fancied an argument about it. The food was spicy and not in a good way. The tortilla's for the fajita's were a very thick breadlike consistency and they were not very nice at all. It felt like you were eating in a food court rather than a restaurant. My husband had a steak and it wasn't great.The prices were expensive as it lacked atmosphere. Back to the waiter...he was rude when we tried to  pay the bill. All in all, there are many more lovely places to eat in Vegas than this place. I wouldn't go again.

Stopped in tonight (Wednesday) at about 8:30 pm and was dining solo.  The hostess asked if I wanted a place at their shared tables - I expect this was because they had some type of private event going on taking up a lot of spots that are "canal" side. I decided I'd rather sit at the bar and was immediately helped by multiple bartenders offering me Margaritas and the like.  I was looking for a lighter and less calorie stuffed meal, so ordered a large Pellegrino w/Lime.  

The bartenders seemed very knowledgeable about the menu and practically congratulated me for my decision to order the Pozole Verde.... which... was.... delicious! The flavor was fantastic! I was a little bit disheartened to see the size of the pork -- not that they were skimpy on the pork overall, just the size of the pieces seemed awfully tiny compared to other Pozoles I've had. I probably could have stopped there as I wasn't ravenous -- the Pozole was probably about a cup and a half. Not too big and not too small. 

I ended up deciding I was hungry enough to get something else and tried their Tuna Ceviche Tostada.  The presentation was simple -- one corn tortilla, tostada style, secured on the plate by some guacamole (underneath) to prevent slipping around the plate during transport and topped with a Tuna ceviche that had a cilantro and serrano pesto with onions and jalapeno.  The bartender had warned me that it was spicy, but I guess I didn't get a very spicy jalapeno because I could have handled more heat.  On top of the well portioned ceviche was about a 1/4 avocado which was ripe and tasty.  

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal with Canonita and will likely visit again sometime this week to try another dish as many of my bar neighbors seemed to have some delicious dishes in front of them.

I had doubts about the authenticity of the food at first,  being that this is a Mexican place at the Venitian hotel. And though I cant say the dishes were 100% traditional, everything my party tried was delicious. Im not sure if the twist they put on their dishes is just to make them unique or if they are fused with a different culture, all I know is that the flavors blended well and left me wanting to go back! I ordered the Chiapaneco citrus glazed salmon, which was marinated in a delicious tamarind sauce, topped with mandarins and served with a sweet potato hash. Honestly,  I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed it! My boyfriend ordered the Mazatin seared ahi with quinoa salad and that was also really good. The ahi was seared with this really tasty chile sauce... best seared tuna ive ever had! He also ordered the shrimp calamari cocktail, which I expected to be a bland American version, but was actually very close to the authentic Mexican style... also very good. My sister and her girlfriend tried the chicken enchiladas and a Tarascan chicken soup, which I did not try but they loved. And last but not least, my absolute favorite thing was the sangria de rojo, which is a blend of sangria and margarita. Now I want to go back to try every other drink on the menu!
**The service and the view were great too!**

This place is located in the Venetian and has great tacos, burritos and enchiladas.  The service is always good and I frequently take colleagues here.  My favorite appetizer is the chips, salsa and guacamole and the drinks are delicious as well!  The prices are a bit high but I get a corporate discount which is nice.  Would recommend for a nice Mexican food night out!

Finding a place to eat on Christmas without reservations was always going to be difficult, so we settled on Canonita. Fortunately, everything turned out really well. The service was attentive and friendly. The roasted mussels were very good indeed. I had the catch of the day, which was mahi-mahi, in a spicy tomato broth. My friend had the wild mushrooms enchiladas. Both were very delicate and rich in flavors. On the whole, a wonderful experience.

I had the pleasure of dining here today (6/11/10) actually while exploring the Venetian for all its wonders. It happened to be happy hour when we were passing by.  The big happy hour menu is what caught our attention and from there we were drawn in like moths to a flame. 

We were seated very quickly and the setting overlooked the Venetian's waterway. A nice romantic scene for you and your loved one. The waiter Alejandro who's name brought Lady GaGa's song to mind immediately. Alejandro, Alejandro, Ale, Ale, Ale, Ale, Alejandro... however many times she repeats it. He was awesome.

I was in a chicken taco kind of mood as usual, but I quickly changed my mind after I saw the chicken enchiladas. You had your choice of toppings but I can only remember the molé poblano for whatever reason. My wife opted for the chicken tacos surprisingly. 

Of course I ordered a Modelo (it was fitting at the time) and my wife ordered the cape cod. We should have ordered chips and salsa because the drinks came right away which was cool, but since we haven't really eaten anything prior to, our buzz started to kick in after a few rounds. The cape cod was very strong as you can taste more vodka then cranberry juice, but we were in Vegas so who cared. The stronger the better.  

When the food arrived we were slightly tipsy and before my wife got the opportunity top dig in I reached for my fork and blocked her from grabbing the chicken tacos. I wanted to take a few snaps of them as they were. It's what I do. 

The chicken tacos according to my wife were very flavorful and juicy. My chicken enchiladas were excellent and I would highly recommend them topped with the molé poblano sauce as it adds a wonderful kick. The black beans and cilantro rice were the perfect sides. 

If you get the opportunity give it a try and if possible see if you can get seated in Alejandro's section. He was very attentive. We had an awesome experience!

I have been to a lot of Mexican restaurants in Vegas and the rest of America but this place is up-scale.  Some real traditional Mexican cooking with good quality fresh ingredients.  You might have to listen to some tourists on the canal and some gondola captain singing, but the food is great.   Fresh flour tortillas, Pork Empanadas, with a fantastic red sauce.  Some of the best guacamole that wasn't all garlicy.  It was good and fresh.  Also had a fantastic vegy chile relleno with dried fruit, masa crust, wonderful roasted vegetables, rice and a great poblano sauce  and would be just fantastic if not for the goat cheese.  Why must I always have to eat goat cheese and butternutt squash in nice restaurants.  The salsa is a smoky variety with good chips and some fantastic queso or fundido.  This place has been around a long time and is really good.
Loved the food, we came back for a third time. They have the best appetizers and drinks. Javier the Bartender was very friendly, great customer service.

The location in the Venetian is excellent, right on the canal which is cool, making the atmosphere great. Service was good. Unfortunately, I feel like the dining experiences in the Las Vegas area just aren't as exciting as they used to be. Canonita is no exception. I'm not saying the food was bad. But, for the prices these places are charging, I want to feel like I am getting my money's worth. And, come on... charging $4 for chips and salsa?  and another $9 to add guac???   Our dinner just was not exciting enough to make me want to come back. Standard Mexican fair at twice the price. . .

We stayed at the venetian and were too lazy to get onto the strip for a brunch place, so we ended up here. It turned out really well! When you first get there, they ask you if you want a table "outside" or "inside" which is funny because its actually all the same, but if you want the fake clouds and view of the gondolas going by, say "outside". The ambiance is perfect for either an intimate date, but its also ideal for large groups because of their huge tables. We had a group of 12 and were seated on Saturday afternoon within minutes. 

The make-your-own Bloody Mary station ended up confusing my friends with all the options...one of them basically ended up with an entire salad in her drink, since the vegetables were unlimited. But hey, if you like blue-cheese stuffed olives and green beans galore, you will be happy! 

If you're vegan, the options here are a bit limited. The rice has butter, but you can ask for the seasoned potatoes which were really good! The manager specifically came out to deliver the item to assure everything was okay with everyone's specific dietary restrictions. 

I got the breakfast burrito which is served with a little salsa on top and one chip. LITERALLY ONE CHIP. I guess they did it to make it look pretty, but it was a very interesting sight. I love that the cheese was melted onto the entire surface of the tortilla instead of being thrown in the middle and disregarded...it was almost like a quesadilla-turned-burrito. Maybe I'll order a separate side of chips next time I come, so I'm not disappointed by the one lonely chip accompanying my burrito. Overall a good experience though!

This is a solid, but certainly not fantastic, dining experience that is enhanced by being adjacent to the canal at Venetian.  We always get the 3 taco plate, which I guess is as close to a "bargain" as you can get on the strip.  My favorites are fish and pork, with the pork having a very good pineapple salsa.  The queso fundido has been an appetizer we go back to several times over.  The chorizo is a good addition, but can be greasy, so be advised.  Also, the cheese hardens fairly quickly, so this is an appetizer I wouldn't linger over.

Standard Mexican beer selection and some margarita choices.  It's a fun way to not lose your shirt on dinner on the strip.

We passed this restaurant by a couple of times and after looking at the other restaurants available, this menu looked the best.

The pricing was great. The portions were filling and the service was good as well.

Chips and salsa are usually a hit or miss at most Mexican restaurants.  It was a hit here. The guacamole was fresh. I did wish the salsa was a little more spicy, but i guess we need to keep it 'PC," right? Both dishes we ordered were fabulous.

And you can't beat the gondoliers (is that even a word?) passing by singing their hearts out.

I'd go back in a heartbeat.

NOT AFRAID of FLAVOR.  So happy to find a restaurant that is not afraid of flavor.  Starting right off with the guacamole that was nicely spicy and super fresh.   Don't skip it!

We ordered family style for the table, and the overall favorites were the tuna, the beef tacos and the pork.  But, don't overlook the shrimp, and the steak.  Nothing on the table was a disappointment.   

Marco was our waiter.  He did a good job wrangling a large group.  And, the margaritas were good, but truly the highlight was the food.  Highly recommend this casual eatery.
Very pricey for very bad quality food. The outdoor view is nice. Waiter was very nice. They should fire the chef or the management who orders bad quality of food

This place was pretty good! The salsa is different than your typical authentic Mexican restaurant and it wasn't spicy at all, but it had good flavor. Everything we ordered was good. My only complaint is that they charge for chips and salsa.
Pork Belly Tacos; Cheat Day! Great Margaritas.

Variety of breakfast & lunch dishes is wide enough that both meat eaters and vegetarians will all find something satisfactory to eat. 

Prices are reasonable.  My breakfast, the levantate, was plenty of food for $11.95.  Tasty. Hand made fresh tortillas cost $1.50 for 5. 

Server was sweet natured, smiling, helpful. 

Tables situated alongside the fake gondola canal with the singing boatman gliding by just screams ersatz Las Vegas experience. 

Disneyland for barely grown-ups.

The food was good but I wouldn't say for the price it was great. Way over priced for what you get. Our waitress messed up our order and split the kids lunch (quesadilla) which I didn't ask for. Luckily she did because my son did not like it.  So that saved me money. The waitress was slow to get us refills on drinks. Save your money and go to a fancy restaurant, you'll pay the same price. I paid the same amount for lunch here as I did for a 5 Star meal at Chef Ramsay's Hell's Kitchen at Cesar's Palace. Which was unbelievable good! Best service there too! Again, good food, over priced, and slow service.

Review for taco truck. 

Got pork and beef tacos. Both good. Beef better than pork. Could have been higher temp. I also god chipotle and felt chipotle was on par with these.
Came here with my husband for breakfast and it was great! We both had the huevos rancheros and it was different but really good. Mexican food with a twist.
Wow!! Carne Asada was awesome!!!! Cooked perfectly, very flavorful and tender. Also the sweet tamales it came with were amazing!!!

Nah, not great food, but at least it's cheap. Food gets 2 stars, but price gets 3 stars.

3 tacos for $5.25 - tasted like it was from taco bell.

2 chicken tostadas for $6 something - tasted like mush, but cheap

salsa & chips for under $2 and they gave a lot of salsa.

Is this place great? No. 
Would I go back again? No.
Is it cheap? Yes.
Good food but stay away from the Steak Tampiquena tougher than a rubber tire - toughest meat ever !!! Awesome Barbacoa

Nice restaurant with good atmosphere and great service. The food is a little different than what I'm used to living here in central California. The sauces were much sweeter, but I can't complain about the portion size. I could barely walk when I left!

Delicious food. We went 530 no res on wednesday.we got there in time for happy hour drink specials and she even reminded us to order another drink before happy hour was over.
  The food was really good . I had carne asada. It was  delicious.  The spinach salad yum. My friends had burrito and queso.all very good atmosphere nice if a little too bright. Fun to be sitting on canal. Our server was excellent

Group Dining Event Review: 

We had a banquet here. We had a party of about 18. It was a bit difficult for me to plan since I'm out of state. I had some issues dealing with some other restaurants and finding a place that worked with our budget. For the event pricing, the prices were reasonable and the food and ambiance matched what we were looking for. 

The event coordinator, Jessica, was great to work with. She was accommodating and very responsive. In our party, we had a child, an infant, and someone with special needs. Jessica and the restaurant staff were accommodating.

We had a special menu that our guests were allowed to pick from at the time of the event. I liked that we were able to do that instead of deciding days/weeks before the event. Our table was along the canal and we were situated a little further from everyone else. It worked out perfectly for us. Everyone at the table enjoyed the chips, salsa, guac, and their menu items. I had the Vaquero Beef Rib. It was excellent! It was tender and the polenta that came with it was great. I also tried the Chile Relleno. It was good. We had a great time and great food - we couldn't be happier with our choice.

I love this place so the low rating is a shame.  They changed their Chili relleno dish from a delightful special dish to a typical treatment. I hope they reconsider. 

Otherwise it's a great choice for margaritas and casual Mexican when you're on the strip. It's on the canal for an "outside"dining experience when the weather doesn't cooperate. ..

Located in the heart of the beautiful Venetian !!!Very nice atmosphere and good service. You can sit by the canal and enjoy the view and listen to the Gondola singers. Waitress was sweet,she explained a lot of things to us. Food came out fast but it wasn't as expected. Was on the spicy side and gave us acid burn but it was a good experience to try something different.
The wild mushroom enchilada comes with a cilantro cream sauce that will move the earth for you. Fresh margaritas...chips and caramelized onion salsa plus a terrific mole chick tortilla soup!!!!!! Wow

My friend and I came here for an early dinner. They were very accommodating to us being short on time (45 minutes to eat) and also my gluten free diet. I was highly impressed with the service, the location, the taste and quality of the food, and the overall atmosphere. My friend ordered the steak fajitas and I ordered the tres tacos. Both were excellent! I hope I can come back here.

Review:  Margaritas, chips, guacamole

Since we were in The Venetian and had just finished seeing The Jersey Boys, we were wanting a little late night snack.  We timed it just right at this place - 9:00pm to closing is Happy Hour and Margaritas are just $5!  Fresh ones too!  No mix.  Fresh lime juice.  Very well made.  We snacked on spicy guacamole and chips, as we sat at the edge of the canal watching the last of the evening's gondola riders go by.  We even witnessed a proposal take place in one of the gondolas!  Good server, very nice ambiance, delicious margaritas!

This outfit to me is 5 stars, within their target market.  The food is fantastic, the portions are neither too small or too big, the service is impeccable, the view in Venetian is great on the faux canal, you can't go wrong.  If you wanna go wrong in Venetian go to the worse-location, ludicrously priced and portioned Aqua-Knox and land an arrogant waiter or slow cocktail waitress.  

Cañonita has delivered 5 stars repeatedly to me, co-workers and customers.

This place was great. It is inside the Venetian. We sat at a table in the bar area, which over looked the gondolas going by.  The drinks were strong and tasty. The chips were yummy and the guacamole was some of the best I have ever had in my life!  Our server Danielle was fun and terrific and made the whole experience memorable. We will definitely be back.

One of my favorite stops while in town!! I've only spent time at the bar but the service is great, fellow patrons are fun and the vanilla & pineapple infused tequila is delicious. Alex and Danny didn't disappoint today. Alex shared some inside info that's sure to make my upcoming Birthday party a hit!
Good food, fine happy hour, shit service. Don't go if you're in a hurry
Omg this place is amazing amazing drinks to dessert food and service amazing I can't wait to go back

Great quality food - I just didn't like the "reduction" aka Barbecue sauce but other than that the food is great.

The servers here are knowledgable about Mexican cuisine and are fantastic.

The guac was delicious and the view amazing.  I had to eat solo while attending a conference but the waitress was super attentive and made me feel very welcome.  Next time in Vegas, I'll be heading back.  The food was good, but I'm fortunate to eat a lot of excellent Mexican dishes.

Had an amazing time the food was great. This is the second time I've been and both times I had a great time. The food is excellent and the service is amazing. My server Jerry great. He was always well aware if we needed anything and insightful of the dishes served. He recommended this oyster dish which was really something to come back for. I look forward to spending a great dinner with my family here again.

Invited Chef's Tasting, Not Billed but tipped appropritately:

Told that the Chef would be cooking for us, but offering up menus in case something specific struck our eye, it was with gracious tableside service from a middle-aged Hispanic gentleman that the afternoon commenced and with a jokey sort of professionalism guiding us through the afternoon one really could not have asked for better, Northeastern-born but Border Grill educated Chef Donna Willey also stopping by frequently to discuss her inspiration and training, as well as techniques implemented in more than a dozen plates plus two trios of drinks.

Undoubtedly a 'touristy' setting, the views of artificial sky alongside the canal juxtaposing traditional Mexican decorations within the restaurant's confines, it was with a trio of Margaritas and chips rewarmed from an outside source that the dining began and finding both the green salsa and Jalapeno Infusion far too poignant for my tastes it was on the Vanilla tinged pineapple cocktail and guacamole that I focused, the former a formidable refresher with alcohol well balanced by the fruit while the later was rather dull without a bit of the chipotle salsa added to taste.

At this point ready to see what the kitchen could do, tables around us receiving all sorts of divine looking plates, it was perhaps ten minutes later that a sizzling cast-iron skillet arrived and with the smell of smoke quickly filling the air it was only once things finally cooled down that we finally had a chance to indulge in the snappy butterflied shrimp, meaty mussels, and housemade chorizo teaming with spice, each taste as good as the last with a second dish of queso fundido proving most fortuitous in timing as the still-bubbling cheese topped in jalapenos was a bit timid on its own, but a near-perfect addition when spread on  flour tortillas with some of the seafood piled on top.

At this point requesting service be slowed as our sizable two-top was already filled to capacity with plates, glasses, and utensils it was next to a trio of the Chef's signature appetizers that we were treated and progressing left to right one would be hard pressed to cite a single bite as less than superlative - the ceviche showing clean acidity alongside its accoutrements while the Pozole was equally well balanced and intensely vegetal, the 'gordita' a lightly fried set of bites that was at once bold yet nuanced, creamy but acidic, and entirely greaseless with just the right amount of heat.

Obviously unable to forgo anything stuffed with duck, plus generally fancying most things featuring mushrooms, the next three plates were served in slow succession and although the cinnamon tinged fowl stuffed inside a smoky pepper was indeed quite good it was in fact the fungus that saw me swoon, both the black bean laminated Portobello bathed in fennel tomato sauce and the signature enchiladas showing a deft hand with quality produce, Chef Willey's time at Border Grill undoubtedly well spent.

At this point progressing towards heavier proteins, plus an entirely unexpected Brazilian fish stew, suffice it to say that while the Carne Asada struck me as something I could have just as easily had anywhere both the Barbacoa and Moqueca were amongst the very best bites of the meal, the former brightly spiced and easily cut with a spoon before being added to corn tortillas to form makeshift tacos while the later was a seamless marriage of sea and sweet with coconut milk playing foil to notes of spice that only became evident after a satisfied breath between bites.

Moving onward to desserts, originally offered two but eventually seeing three, it was with a double espresso over ice that the meal would come to an end and although personal preferences obviously have much to do with all things in dining one would be challenged to find a better tres leches in town, the fully saturated sponge entirely sweet yet finding levity in strawberries and meringue, while both the brownie and the flan were also quite good - the former obviously quite hefty while the latter proved far lighter than other versions offered in town, the XO just boozy enough to give it some kick while the unrefined sugar syrup helped soften the blow.

Clearly given the VIP treatment, and as such sampling a far greater swath of the menu than the average duo possibly could, the food that Chef Willey is creating at Canonita is at once almost universally approachable yet at the same time bold and complicated in a way that few other Casino-based ethnic restaurants would dare.  Admittedly underwhelmed by more routine plates like guacamole, queso fundido, as well as carne asada and still perplexed as to why the restaurant would outsource something like tortilla chips when executing more complex items so well there is no doubt that a great meal can be had at Canonita by those willing to venture away from the tried and true, particularly when taking into account the vibe and the view.

Well, I payed for not listening to my fellow yelpers. Being from Texas, I have very high standards for Mexican food. This did not meet those expectations. Chips and salsa aren't free. No retried beans. No Spanish rice. No sweetnlow. But forget all that, the food is bland. No taste. Even the salsa. Disappointed for sure.

I had flautas and tried the mango and classic margaritas. 

The flautas were crunchy and had plenty of meat inside.  The margaritas were really good...it's really like juice so that can be dangerous.  Service was great and the food came at a reasonable amount of time.  Beware of getting guacamole with the free chips! $11 for a small bowl make sure you wipe the bowl clean!

came to Canonita today before we checked in to our hotel. our waitress Danielle recommended the mussels and shrimp appetizer. it was delicious!! I would highly recommend this dish. order extra bread (you're going to need it the super delicious sauce). it ordered the strawberry lemon drop. fresh strawberry MADE this drink and it was only 5$on happy hour. my husband ordered the classic margarita, he loved it. err sat right by the canal where the gondolas were passing through. couldn't all for a more  beautiful/romantic view. definitely coming back.

added we were here celebrating our anniversary. didn't get a dessert or anything offered. :/

A delicious Mexican restaurant overlooking a river in an Italian setting, what more could you want.
Or as my eleven year old put it:
#inside #outside #Vegas #Italy

Nortena dish was great!
Delicious mexican. Although I'm not an expert on mexican food I enjoyed this experience. Service was great also. Try the beef roast thingy. Yummy.

Very impressed with the flavors.. i was spectacle to find a food Mexican restaurant in a hotel but this food was amazing. The portions are a good size. You need to do the chips and guacamole its finger licking. They took a while to bring our food out but it was worth it.

Awful. We arrived and asked for a table next to the canal. They informed us that they were reserved even though they were empty. The canal tables remained empty through our entire meal. They charge 3 dollars for chips and salsa. Any Mexican place that charges for this is a joke. Especially when the entrees were $25 a plate. I had a salad that had some strange dressing that was OK. That was the highlight of the meal. Then they delivered some barbacoa with rice and beans. The rice was green and flavorless. The black beans were the same. I've had better seasoning on beans from a can. The barbacoa was tender, but the sauce was awful. Only salvation was to dip it in the bland ass hot sauce they provided. There was no heat at all in anything.

If you need a go-to place to be when you're staying at the Venetian and you enjoy Mexican cuisine (and drinks) the. You come right down here next to the canals. 

Javier- the man of the hour. He did such an amazing job making us feel at home and being so hospitable. He is an honorable man. 

The wife and I got the Mexican Chopped Salad for lunch and it was so fulfilling. 

The chips and salsa - on point.

We enjoyed a great dinner at Cañonita in the Venetian during CES 2018. The barbacoa pork was delicious and the sauce served with it was very tasty. I didn't care for the rice. The pitcher of margarita was pretty average and seemed light on tequila. Service was decent. Restaurant was a little noisy and crowded.

I like this place for it's location and the related ambience.  I came here for happy hour which has reasonable drink prices but limited draft selection.  They had interesting cocktail offerings; however, nobody raved about their drink.  Looking over the menu, I would probably only return for happy hour.

Amazing restaurant option for casual dining on the Strip with a view of the Gondoliers passing by singing in Italian...located right on the Grand Canal in the Venetian. I loved their Pan Seared Mahi and the Warm Banana Brownie, yummm.

Just OK Mexican food. 

I had the 3 ceviches off the appetizers, the chips and salsa, and the tres leches cake. The ceviches were good except for the mahi one. The chips and salsa were really good and a great value for just $3 (even though I think all Mexican restaurants should serve this for free). The tres leches cake was kind of disappointing. I love tres leches cake and I know how to make a very good one and this one was kind of dry and not as spongy as it should be. 

The best part about this place is happy hour. Margaritas are $5 and well drinks are $3. That's great for Vegas prices! Also, the location of this place is cool--right by the cannel. 

In other words, come for happy hour.

A group of 8 of us ducked into this place after a) not feeling the overpriced food court and b) not feeling ballerific enough to eat some place fancy. If you read my other reviews, you know I'm especially hard on any Mexican food, especially ones located under a fake blue sky and a much cleaner version of Venice's grand canal. 

Boy, was I surprised. I started off with a few bites of the ceviche and ordinary chips and salsa, which were both surprisingly tasty. I ordered the three pork tacos with corn tortillas and they were done very well. Their flavors weren't too strong, which I liked. 

Can I just write that it tasted, well, good?

Oh, and the horchata...magnificent! Perfectly balanced between sweetness and thickness. One of the best cups I've had.

For the price, atmosphere, location, and food, this place strikes a good balance for those on a budget but don't want to wander onto the strip looking for the McD's/Denny's/Chipotle around the corner.

GREAT MEXICAN DOESN'T HAVE TO BE DIVEY

Canonita's food is right up there with the best Mexican I've had in LA, San Diego, and even Mexico City.  Since it opened, I have not gone to Vegas without eating there.

Everything is delicious without exception - right down to the salsa and chips that are hard not to fill up on.  Even the rice, which comes as a side with just about everything, is not to be missed.  The star of the meal, however, is always their salsa verde - hands down the best salsa verde I've ever had.  Ask for a side of it (they will charge you $1 or so but it's worth it) and pour it onto whatever you end up eating.

Don't expect a taqueria in the conventional sense because Canonita has little in common with the holes-in-the-wall where you often find the best Mexican food.  Which is not to say Canonita isn't authentic - it's just a gentrified (and thereby both healthier and more elaborate) version of the same cuisine.

I would give canonita a 3.5 in stars. I came here for breakfast this morning with my boyfriend. 

Great location on the canals, we enjoyed our breakfast right next to the canal. 

I got the Mexican torta. It seems like a lot of bread for the food inside, so I took it off the bread. There were tortilla
Chips underneath it anyways. I do wish they offered this dish as an egg dish instead of a sandwich. I also wish that it came with two eggs. The inside of the sandwich was very tasty! 

My boyfriend got the breakfast burrito. He said it was okay (I definitely chose the better dish!) 

Service was fast but nothing special. It was a good meal, which is why I would rate it 3.5.

This is my 3rd time coming here! this place is just awesome and amazing view of the gondola rides. 
I never liked chile relano so I didn't order one here but my friend did.. and I regretted not having ordered it. It was amazing! I ordered the vegetarian fajitas, it was good but chile relano was much much better. Everyone else loved their food as well here and it was our favorite spot for restaurants in vegas so far.

A good alternative to the food court. This indoor food truck's tacos are so good, I've had them twice in as many days! Don't expect Taco Bell food here - they are way better than that. My favorite were the Chicken Tinga tacos, but had a combo and they ALL delicious.

Came in for some drinks and appetizers at the bar while we waited for the rest of the party to finish up gambling. 

I noticed that they had an agave margarita on the menu and was excited about that so ordered that to drink. I was very happy with my choice. Although the margarita is a little small for $15 I get why. It was delicious. I normally don't like my margaritas too sweet but yet not too strong either and I think they nailed it with this one. 

I ordered the ahi tostada to start with and after tasting my first bite I was addicted. It doesn't look like it's too much but it ended up being a good amount once you start eating it. It had a little kick too it which I liked. 

We then ordered some chips and guacamole to share. It comes with salsa too which is great, another great choice. The guacamole tasted so fresh and the chips we're a great consistency. 

If the drinks and apps tasted this good I can't wait to come back to try the entrees!

I live in Missoula, MT where authentic Mexican food is rare, and being from Phoenix, Cañonita really delivers delicious and authentic fare. Jesus had the best recommendations; the food, chips, salsa and beverages were upscale and amazing! It was the first time I tried a pineapple margarita...now I will make them at home!   Thank you Jesus for your recommendations! #CañonitaRocks #Cañonita
Great food.  We had fajitas which were great.   Appetizers included queso with tortillas.   Loved sitting in the patio with the boats goi g through the Riviera.    Would recommend this place.

I absolutely love this place. The location is just right, since it sits right by the canal inside the Venetian. You get to admire the gondolas and hear then singing. Our waiter Jesus, was just amazing. He helped us make the perfect selections. The mojitos are the best, highly recommend, which our waiter Jesus recommended and he was right. The food was just incredibly delicious, I did not want to leave any behind even though I was extremely full already lol. Will be back to visit.

My party of two came here for breakfast one weekday morning when it wasn't too busy, and we were seated overlooking the canal, which was fun.  I ordered the Garden Egg White Omelette (with spinach, mushroom, and cheese only), Yogurt and Granola (served with Mexican wedding cookies), and Watermelon Agua Fresca.  Personally, I didn't care for my food - it was all bland to me and I've had better elsewhere.  My dining companion liked her food though (Huevos BLT), so maybe I just didn't order the right thing.  I love watermelon so I liked my drink and found it to be pretty refreshing.  Service was decent, and our food was brought out pretty fast.  It was neat sitting by the water and seeing gondolas go by, so I found the ambiance to be nice.  If the food were any tastier, I'd give Cañonita a four, but since it wasn't, three stars it is based on my experience.

This was the first restaurant we ate at during our most resent visit to Las Vegas.  We ate outside near the canal - so you could see the gondola rides and hear them sing.  It was an AMAZING atmosphere!

We ate chips and guacamole and split some chicken tacos, they were so tasty! The chips are warm and fresh, the guac was so good you could eat it with a fork. 

The best part was the red sangria...i wish I could find the recipe!!! 

This is a great, relaxing restaurant -- you MUST eat there!

Very happy with the quality of the food and service!  I like their chips, salsa and guacamole! I even crave their guacamole from Where I Live (LA) so I always made a stop here while i'm in Vegas. I came in, dine in, twice in this restaurant and very happy with their food, coctails, margarita and service. Our other favorite dish is their first of the day catch fish. Always delicious, never dissapointed. Consistence and friendly people. Definitely will make this my regular place.

Tip: get a couple wedges of lime to squeeze over the pork barbacoa and cilantro rice. Makes it a flawless entree.

Seating was a bit weird as they had several open tables and instantly seated the person who walked up seconds before I did and was also solo, yet I was asked to wait for 30 minutes. Oh well. I walked around browsing shops and sampling gelato.

When I was seated service was pleasant and helpful. I seemed to have to waiters but the gentleman who helped me was very pleasant and suggested the pork barbacoa, even when he knew I was considering a more expensive dish. Plus one star for integrity!

I ordered chips and salsa. A very inexpensive appetizer and I devoured them with joy. Chips were ultra fresh and the salsa had a gentle spice and was tasty.

When the pork arrived it came with warm and supple corn tortilla, sides of rice and black beans. The rice had plenty of flavor but was a hair drier than I prefer. The beans were simple and perfectly cooked. I loathe an undercooked bean and black beans are almost always served that way so I was very pleased.

I urge anyone to ask for a couple lime wedges with this meal. The pork was amazingly falling apart tender and the chipotle BBQ was satisfyingly complex. The squeeze of lime over it offset the "dry" spice pallet of the BBQ sauce and made the pork flawless. 

My only regret was my dinner was so delectable that I no longer have room for the gelato I was eyeing. Ah well. There's always tomorrow! ;)

Enjoyed the chicken tacos on flour tortillas. They had a good flavor. The guacamole was good but i wasn't a huge fan of the salsa. Had a Bloody Mary that was spicy like i had asked. Only downfall was that they only served breakfast until 11am. We had to wait until that time to order the tacos.

Super delicious food. We lucked out with a super awesome server called Ashley who made some great suggestions for us. Everything from our drinks (Watermelon drink) to our mains, the Portabello with super nutritious and delicious greens, and the vegetarian Fajitas ( not on the menu, but suggested and organized by Ashley ) to the yummy dessert ( yes, suggested by Ashley!! ) At our request for less oil, they even delivered on that! :-) 

I've been to this place before- two years ago and had a good experience. Glad to note, staff is still friendly and attentive, and of course food is great!

Typical Vegas resturant... big price little food... ordered the three taco plate, it was good, rice and beans were good... BF started with the 11$ spinach salad... it was really tasty and almost worth that high price. I ordered the $5 happy hour wine and it was awful.. Id stick with beer in the future. Was decent but had better mexican in vegas.. the atmosphere was nice sitting on their 'patio' by the water where the gondolas passed.

My wife and I have stayed at the Venetian twice and the Palazzo right beside it once but this seems to be our favorite lunch stop when we're here. Helps get you in the mood to being in Las Vegas first off with sipping their Cadillac Margarita while sitting by the Grand Canal.  We tend to stick to just the chips with salsa and guacamole and splitting the 6 tacos platter which is perfect. We've always had luck getting great service here and a table by the canal, so that tipped my star rating from 3 to 4.  I've never been for dinner, and doubt I ever would when there are so many other excellent dinner restaurants in the Venetian alone.

Came here for an early Mother's Day celebration. We sat next to the rail with a view of the gondolas. View was very nice. I think for the strip and the Venetian it's gotta be on the less costly restaurants. 

The menu is small. But we ordered the Santa Rosa plate and the "Chicken mole". They were well portioned. And certainly a meal type. It's not going to over stuff you. My plate that included the chicken mole. Was very tasty. 

As appetizers we also went for the Pork Empanadas. Which by the way were very sweet tasting. I am more into sweetness then spicy foods. They were rather small. But I'd definitely go back for those. 

Then for desert we finished with a tres leches . Sharing it. It definitely was "tres leches" it wasn't at all dry. Had sufficient fruit on it as well. 

To drink we had two Horchatas and one Watermelon. I think something like the Horchata was spiked because I felt rather dizzy throughout. 

The service was very nice our waitress was very attentive and quick. The restaurant was actually very empty maybe that's why the service wasn't late. 

The bill was $85 and I would come back.

Let me start by saying that I don't really care for the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.  When I'm in Las Vegas I don't care to spend time wandering around a mall, especially one so big that I've gotten lost more than once (sad but true).  There's only one thing that keeps me visiting the Grand Canal Shoppes, and that's Taqueria Cañonita.  This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, so I seek them out whenever I can.  I've never had a bad dish on the menu, though my favorite is the Tres Tacos.   Served with black beans and cilantro rice, you just cannot go wrong with any of their taco varieties.  I can't even pick a favorite, they are all good.  

Taqueria Cañonita also makes some tasty, tasty margaritas.   For Cinco de Mayo they had a special margarita that involved Serrano peppers that was amazing.  If there isn't a good special going on, The Cañonita Margarita, made with Patron, is also a favorite.  You just cannot go wrong with Patron!  Just watch out because those suckers will sneak up on you!

Whether you sit on the "patio" along the canal or in the bar, this place is always fun.  The one and only reason they don't get 5 stars is because the restroom is located outside the restaurant in the Grand Canal Shoppes food court, which after a few shots of Patron is not exactly ideal.  Still, I'll let it slide and I look forward to visiting them again next time I'm in Las Vegas!

Had the carne asada norteña plate and was impressed at how perfectly seasoned and made to order the steak was. I wasn't in love with the sides it came with though. The chips with salsa and guacamole is a must! I will definitely be back!  Great service and amazing ambience!
I got the chilaquiles and let me just say the eggs were perfect but the machaca was over seasoned. They are wayyyyy too soggy. Kids got pancakes that were

We waited over 45 minutes for a stupid table.  We should of left then.  With a 3 year old, service was slow.  And food is garbage.  They nickel and dime you for extra hot sauce or what type of tortilla you want.  I guess after waiting 45 minutes, I was expecting more but man, just go to chipotle and save money.  Its right behind you in the food court. The chicken fajitas were all onions and pepper with dry chicken bites.  The soup tasted like tomato enchilada sauce, we couldn't eat it and the server asked why?  "um because it tastes like sauce"  "oh um ok".  Then I say 'I will share my onions, can I have more tortilias? After I got them, we got a box because my little guy was passed out in the stroller.  Box and check please!

It was alright. I wanted the soup for dinner but figured I'd need a little something extra so got the empanadas. Maybe it was just me but the soup portion was incredibly small for the price and the empanadas sauce was super sweet. The group that I was with enjoyed their meals but mine was mediocre. They had great drink specials so definitely worth going during happy hour!

Great drinks, awesome Mexican food, super friendly bar tender!

We stopped by here last year for drinks and decided to go back for a snack this year. We each had two drinks plus an order of mushroom tacos and a chicken burrito. It was delicious and the drinks were amazing.

Only thing I didn't like was the middle-aged white-haired guy giving me sexy eyes from a few seats away. Wha?

Hate to ever leave such a low rating...but when you fall upon a Mexican restaurant that actually charges you for for chips and salsa as an appetizer we have a problem ...

Service is lacking at best, received much "stink eye" when I question the $6 charge for simple chips and salsa... I will not go into the $12 drinks... Food was equally bad, so soggy and lacking flavor , and even more adequate portions, I just gave up. 

I get they have to cover the high over head of this location, but at least serve decent food and semi decent costs. 

just saying.

Whenever I go to Vegas, I always want to eat here.  Yes, yes, I know that Los Angeles should have better Mexican food than Vegas, and I have to say that most of the time, it does.  However, there is one particular dish here that I ALWAYS get, so although I may not be the best judge in determining if this restaurant is particularly good overall, at least I know one thing...their barbarcoa plate is DEEEEELICIOUS!  I mean, I have tried bites of other items on their menu from people that I'm eating with, and they all seem pretty decent, however none of them have compared to the barbarcoa.  It's so tender that no knife is needed; the meat just falls apart when poked gently with the fork.  It comes with cilantro rice, which is really good too, black beans, which I don't really eat cuz I'm simply not a fan of beans, and tortillas.  They also have strong, but tasty drinks here, and the servers have always been nice.  And, you can pretend you sitting outside a Venetian restaurant because its right by the gondola ride.  What more can you ask for?!?

2 stars for poor service. I came during happy hour on a Friday and it was not busy at all. After I was seated and had waited 10 mins or so and still no one had come over to my table, I asked a hostess to please send someone over. I ordered a drink, chips & salsa, plus guacamole to start ($14 btw). Everything tasted fine and very fresh, but the waiter only came over once during the hour or so that I was there. He did not stop by to see if I wanted to actually order dinner, so I got the check (which I of course had to flag him down and ask for, and then wait another 10 mins before I got it) and left after paying. Not a great experience overall.

Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: no wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: normal service. Tables right on the edge of the indoor canal with gondolas provides nice ambiance.  

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

1/3 Stars: food is ok... Tastes very clean. Taste like diet Mexican food. I like my Mexican food flavorful and greasy. 

_____

Overall Experience
3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Ambiance is great. Food is meh.
Javier the bartender is Fabulous and you have to try the pineapple/vanilla bean infused tequilla.  It is the best thing I have ever drank.

Service was sub-par for a Venetian restaurant.  It really was a downer in such a unique venue.   This place is along the canal and appears to be a hot spot.  

The food was good but not very imaginative.  The pricing is a bit high for what you get. It was $24 for the beef enchiladas which were just OK.  

There are so many stellar choices at Venetian/Palazzo, I would rather spend my money elsewhere.

Hour 21 of a 24 hour trip to Vegas was spent in the bar at Taqueria Canonita, where I had ok tacos with a crazy good margarita.

Now, my opinion of the tacos may be colored by knowing in a mere 4 hours I'd be stepping off the plane in Los Angeles, soon to fill my mouth and belly with all sorts of delightful Mexican goodies (thinking of it now, I'm not sure why we chose a taqueria in Vegas anyway), so let me tell you about this margarita. 

First, it was 5 bucks--now, 5 bucks is a decent happy hour price in D.C., but in Vegas? Insane. This was called a "Blackberry Fresca Margarita." I'm normally a blended margarita girl, but this delight on ice may have changed my mind. It was fresh blackberries with triple sec and silver tequila, a perfectly refreshing blend of sweet and the 1-2 punch of tequila. Most interestingly, but still wholly enjoyable, was that the glass was rimmed with both salt and sugar, which I've never had. 

I genuinely hope this margarita wasn't a special, because everyone who can should try it! I'm planning an attempt at my own as part of a red-white-and-blue drink spread for July 4 this summer. 

I would sit through the "ok" food in a heartbeat for more of these margaritas.

I think the food is pretty OK.  What really disappointed me was the way they charged for everything.  Like 50 cents for this, or a dollar for that.  Come on- do I need to pay extra for Salsa?!?  Do you even want to live in a a place where you gotta pay extra for salsa.  Salsa should be free- you get it when you sit down.  There is a big picture here people- look at it.  

Anyway try Dos Caminos instead...

Excellent margaritas (just say you don't want it sweet). Great service tonight. Delicious chicken tacos! Excellent veggie fajitas. Chips and guacamole and salsa were fab too. Nothing about this place disappointed us. We are glad we stumbled upon it. I think it might be a different experience if it was very very crowded at the hotel, but tonight it was wonderful.

Cool Mexican restaurant right next to the canal in the Venetian! Amazing scenery. 

We had a party of 10 plus a toddler. We ordered many many mags, all very tasty. The waitress did skip me for the drink orders though. She finally asked me if I wanted something as the food was coming out, but at that point I was over it. 

If you do come here, please whatever you do, GET THE GUAC. I know, Mexican restaurant, the guac is just guac. NO. This place has theeee best guac, I've had in a long time. I filled up on guac before my main meal came. (No regrets.)

We ordered a variety of things. All yummy. I personally got the taco sampler. It came with pork, fish, chicken, mushroom, and steak tacos. All yummy, although the steak was prob the winner. The mushroom was something different though. Also a good option were the Ahi tuna tacos. They come with some king of polenta which is spicy. 

The only thing we weren't too crazy about was the cilantro lime rice. For me, it was a little toooo much cilantro. And i even love it. Its bright green if you don't believe me.

The staff otherwise was super friendly and had great interaction with the toddler in our group. 

Check it out!

This place has a great view of the canal. It was the perfect place to grab lunch. I had a chicken enchilada and it was fabulous. It was the one time I wished I was more hungry so I could finish it. While I wasn't a fan of the cilantro rice because I don't like cilantro, my mom absolutely loved it. This place was also super accommodating to my allergies. 

I knocked off one star because it took us 30+ minutes to get our food and the place wasn't very busy. In addition, they left the beans and tomato on my plate when I specifically said I didn't want any.  But they were quick to fix the mistake. The place was great, just be prepared to wait a little bit for your food.

Inside the Venetian is actually a decent Mexican place. Who woulda thought? The menu is kind of an upscale, semi-authentic Mexican. Not your typical taqueria nor Mexican food you typically find in the US, but not perfectly authentic since this is Vegas. The recommended things are the tacos as an appetizer and the smoked/steamed carnitas in a banana leaf. The guacamole was ok, if not a little bland. Their salsa is ok, lacking a little on spiciness for my taste though. 

The service was friendly and efficient. The place does get loud since your on the canal and you have multitudes of people walking by. There's also a bar with decent drinks. Their margarita mix is way too sweet though.
Came to celebrate our Anniversary. Love this place.  Enjoyed sitting in the patio. Beautiful restaurant. Great service. Food was Amazing. Salmon was very good.
Awful service. We waited 15 minutes before anyone greeted us or gave us water. We were there for 2 hours when it should have taken half the time.

The best Mexican restaurant in Vegas.The service is excellent also the food is delicious. My boyfriend proposed me and all the staff helped him to make my dinner perfect. Specially the chef Edgar who made a beautiful dessert with my ring on it, also the server Hyder very kindly. I truly recommend this place.!
My favorite Mexican restaurant ever. I love the chile relleno and the aqua de sandia is THE best I have ever had in my life(including in Mexico).

You MUST eat here if you visit The Venetian in Vegas. Looking back, I don't think that I've ever skipped lunch/dinner at this joint on any of my visits to Vegas since 2002. The most awesome part about dining here is the fact that you're eating delicious food and drinking bomb-azz sangria right next to the Grand Canal, serenaded by the gondola singers and getting that awesome water reflection off the roof and the lights surrounding the area.

I want to quote About.com's review on Taqueria Canonita (because this is exactly how I feel and couldn't describe it better):
"This inspired eatery takes the flavors of Old Mexico and serves them with an exciting, New American ambiance- all beside the gracefully flowing Grand Canal. Experience true "south of the border" taste and tradition with authentic Mexican offerings like chile rellenos, tacos al carbon or shrimp quesadillas. The taste of their hand-made corn tortillas alone is enough to transport you to another world. The dcor is as vivid as the menu with casual ambiance, high ceilings and bright, bold colors. Taqueria Caonita's lively exhibition kitchen is the restaurant's centerpiece. Enjoy your meal amidst the sculpted steel and wrought-iron gates, colorful Mexican tiles and authentic Mexican folk art. Even better, Taqueria Caonita's patio is set beside the Grand Canal, offering terrific views of our Venetian streetscapes and passing gondolas."

I would also like to add that 90% of the servers who work here are easy on the eyes and know what customer service is all about ;) which makes for an even better dining experience.

Was really disappointed after seeing it had good reviews, took them forever to bring out our drinks then they brought the appetizer out the same time as our food, not once asked about refills, ordered some shots as well and they brought them after they brought to food out.. 30mins from ordering them.

Best meal I've had so far on this trip! I highly recommend the salmon dish. The side of plantains is unbelievable. Our server couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating either. 5 stars all the way!

Ugh.  Dining at the Venetian, I expect a certain standard to be upheld for both service and food quality.  Don't set those expectations if you're going to eat here.  The only thing tasty were the fresh, warm tortilla chips and salsa.  The guacamole was alright, though it was very onion-y.  (I detest onions, on a personal note.)  I ordered the grilled mushroom tacos.  They were awful!  The mushrooms were over-cooked and rubbery.  The queso on the tacos was bland and tasteless.  The tortilla for the tacos themselves was bland as well.  The colleague beside me ordered chicken tacos and complained as well that it was tasteless and inedible.  Neither of us ate more than the first half of one taco (though the platter comes with three).  I heard the Sangria was good from colleagues on the other side of the table.  My boyfriend also enjoyed his pollo con mole, though he said that the chicken was unbearably dry after a few bites.  Such a waste of food!  It really pains me to waste anything, especially food.  So if that sort of thing pains you too, I suggest eating somewhere else.  The service was also slow, curt and overall rather grumpy.  I guess I'd be grumpy too if I worked here and served up this yuckiness.

Expect to pay casino prices for decent Mexican food. Had the fajitas and shrimp burrito.  Lots of shrimp in the burrito is a plus. 

I took away a star because one shouldn't have to pay for chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant.  They also charged for a side of pico de gallo. Don't nickel and dime patrons paying $20 for a burrito.

First of all, this place is right on the canal (the only place to be so) and therefore that alone earns it several of its stars. I mean, when you have something as special and romantic as a Venice canal with gondolas passing by every 15mnts and gondoliers serenading their guests, why wouldn't you take full advantage of it!! 

The place itself was very vegetarian-friendly, albeit relied heavily on mushrooms (which I'm allergic to). The only downside of this place was that they were unwilling to do any substitutions at all, which means for a mushroom-allergic person such as myself, there weren't really that many vegetarian options left. We tried the guac-chips and fondido as well as sides of beans and cilantro rice.

I went to Taqueria Canonita with a large group.  In our party was a 50-year-old, white southerner who, we later find out, eats nothing but meat and potatoes.  And has truly never had Mexican food.

It was hilarious watching this extremely polite man's reactions as we tried to explain what a burrito is or why anyone would slow-roast pork on a banana leaf.

He eventually settled on three soft tacos with rice but was perplexed with the color of the restaurant's cilantro rice.  "Now, I hope you don't mind me asking but is green a normal color for rice?"

I really liked Taqueria Canonita.  I tried the Pepita Crab Cakes and the Smoked Chicken Quesadilla as appetizers.  Both were very flavorful.  I was actually surprised with the crab cakes because I usually compare them against those found in New England.  They were solid, especially given that we were sitting in the middle of the desert.

The chips were just okay but the salsa was good.  And the guacamole was excellent and they give you a ton of it.
